The last few months have seen immense suffering and hardship from storms and flooding. However the outbreak of the Coronavirus has quite literally changed everyones lives and turned society upside down.
However, The Salvation Army is resolute and strong and just as we did in the Spanish Flu pandemic, and during the bombing and the Blitz we will carry on, doing what we can to support people and communities  in the ways that we can, within the Government guidelines.
In true Salvation Army Spirit, our greatest strength is our flexible, responsive local presence. Right now, each of our 650 corps and community centres will know exactly what the most effective things are to do. We are not just responding to the virus impact in one or two ways, but dozens and dozens of different ways, from food banks to counselling, from supporting NHS isolation units to checking up on people who are living alone
Please give what you can to enable us to help as many people as possible!
Title: BRUNSWICK SCARBOROUGH FOOD BANK COVID 19 APPEAL

Description:
Even before Covid, there has been a huge increase in the need for food banks. I aim to raise £1,000 for the Trussel Trust, which is a national food bank charity. 

I believe that the fallout from the Covid-19 pandemic in the UK will result in hundreds of thousands, if not millions of additional people unable to cope financially, though no fault of their own - mostly due to a massive increase in unemployment. So, food banks have already come under increasing pressure. When the furlough scheme ends this will almost certainly become even worse.

I am working from home and 'shielding' for an unknown number of weeks or months, and wanted to help the outside world cope with the current crisis somehow: hence my exercise bike 'cycling' challenge,

I normally use the exercise bike for 2-3 hours a week so, my Cycling target is a challenge. A few days ago, I had the idea, so I used Google Maps to see how far that would be: 1,530 kilometres - 950 miles.

Starting on Friday 8th May, VE Day, this should allow me to 'get to John O'Groats' by VJ Day: Saturday 15th August, if not before. Feel free to donate here for the Trussel Trust.

I originally thought this might take me about three months, but I have got noticeably faster as I progresssed, so that I now expect to reach 1,530 Km around the 10th of July.
Title: Andrew's CycLeJoG Challenge

Description:
We would like to raise £1000 to help those in our local community who are facing extremely difficult times right now.

We have supported the Food Bank at Burnley FC in the Community (part of Burnley Together) for a number of years and have seen first hand the amazing work they do to help those most in need. A spokesperson for the charity told us that they have seen triple the number of people needing help as a direct result of COVID 19 and therefore need all the help they can get.

As you know these are tough times for us all, and for some, everyday life could be made near impossible if it wasn’t for the amazing work of charities like this. So please, donate what you can, spread the word to those around you and support us in our efforts to help those most in need!

Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page. 

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Blessed Trinity supporting Burnley Food Bank

Description:
﻿When faced with hunger, it's difficult to prepare for the unexpected.

Caligor Coghlan Pharma Services would like to give back to the community.  The Trussell Trust support a nationwide network of food banks and together they provide emergency food and support to people locked in poverty, and campaign for change to end the need for food banks in the UK. ﻿

As a thank you to our employees for their giving, we will match the total employee contributions.

Every donation matters and every pound helps! Donate today!
Title: CCPS Raising Money for UK Food Banks

Description:
As I’m unable to get a haircut at the moment I thought I’d give myself a silly one in aid of food bank charity The Trussell Trust. I will live stream the trim from my living room for those who want to watch! It will either be on 25th April or when I reach the £300 goal, whichever is soonest.

Food banks are especially important during the current crisis as people are unable to go out and get vital supplies. Elderly and poor people should not go without food at any time, so please consider giving what you can to this cause.

Message from Trussell Trust:

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Description:

Title: Donate to the Trussell Trust (Food Bank Network)

Description:
Last year, Trussell Trust provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we want to support the food banks that provide a vital service for those who are in crisis. As a nation, no one should be left hungry or destitute but illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Food banks are unfortunately needed throughout the UK even when we aren't facing a global pandemic and now even more during these unprecedented times we must help those who need it. 

Covid-19 is expected to push millions into poverty in the UK and with more facing financial struggles, make it even harder for families to put food on their tables - something we all take for granted. With many not being able to have one decent meal a day during these times of crisis we want to do our bit by raising as much as possible for the Trussell Trust who do amazing work across the UK. 

In order to help, some of the SWW Marketing team will be running 100km each (so 200km in total) over 10 consecutive days starting from Tuesday 14th April and will finish on April 23rd. 

The Trussell Trust support a nationwide network of food banks and together they provide emergency food and support to people locked in poverty.

In the UK, more than 14 million people are living in poverty – including 4.5 million children. The Trussell Trust support more than 1,200 food banks in the UK to provide a minimum of three days’ nutritionally-balanced emergency food to people who have been referred to them in crisis, as well as support to help people resolve the crises they face. 

You can find out more about their amazing work here https://www.trusselltrust.org

Please donate anything you can to help the millions who are struggling to eat.
Title: 100k in 10 days for UK food banks

Description:
There are lots of things we will miss about rowing this summer: training with our friends; getting an awesome AIO tan; the excitement of racing and representing our college! But there is one tiny bonus, and that is we will save a bit of money through not taking part in races next term. So we have decided as a club, why not do some good with that instead? We would like to encourage our members, if able, to donate the cost of a post training brunch, or a race entry fee, or a celebratory beer, and together we can raise some funds for the Cambridge City Food Bank. 

Last year Cambridge City Food Bank provided 9,243 3- day emergency food supplies to families in crisis across Cambridge. With the current Covid-19 situation, that need is undoubtably only going to increase. For more information on the vital work this group does please visit https://cambridgecity.foodbank.org.uk
Title: HHBC fundraiser for Cambridge City Food Bank

Description:
Every year in Letchworth we knock on peoples doors asking for donations, arrange a summer concert and hold coffee mornings to help raise money for the Big Collection. This year we have not been able to do those things, yet the  demand for our services has increased dur to Covid -19

All donations to the Big Collection directly support The Salvation Army’s work to care for people who are vulnerable or in need. This includes supporting people experiencing homelessness, running care homes and day centres for older people, reuniting families through our Family Tracing Service and providing a place of safety for adult victims of modern slavery.

Through a network of over 650 churches and community centres, we offer compassionate support, a listening ear and practical help to those in need. Our work includes:

  • Supporting men, women and families who are experiencing homelessness
  • Running care homes and day centres for older people
  • Reuniting families through our Family Tracing Service
  • Offering training and advice to people looking for sustained employment
  • Providing a place of safety for adult victims of modern slavery.



The Salvation Army is a Christian Church & registered Charity working in 130 countries worldwide and is one of the largest and most diverse providers of social welfare in the world. In the UK and Republic of Ireland this work includes more than 800 Salvation Army social service centres and community churches. We provide unconditional friendship, support and very practical help to people in crisis and need and work with children, homeless people, all adult victims of modern slavery and those dealing with drug and/or alcohol addiction.
Title: Letchworth Food Bank COVID-19 Response

Description: As we all adapt to self isolation, the number of people on low incomes has increased and donations to food banks are suffering. Description:
Dear friends and colleagues, 

Welcome to our third annual winter fundraiser! Last year we raised £500 for Jimmy's homeless shelter, so we hope we can top that! This year we are raising funds for the Cambridge City Foodbank again. Winter can be very difficult for those in our communities who are struggling, and the holidays can exacerbate that. The Foodbank is seeded by the Trussell Trust and provides food, sanitary and household supplies, and meter cards for gas and electricity to people in need. 

Food bank use is at an all-time high in the UK and your donations of food and money will go a long way. This winter, help people who are forced to decide to 'heat or eat', and bring some holiday comfort to people in need! Here's how you can help:

2. Donate money using this page.

You can get more info about the Cambridge City Food Bank here: https://cambridgecity.foodbank.org.uk/

Title: James's 24 hour Le Mans for Food Banks

Description:
Since the outbreak of COVID-19 across London, food banks have been struggling to cope with the increase in demand. The First Love Foundation Tower Hamlets Food Bank is in desperate need of financial support during this difficult time. Out of the 326 local authorities in England, Tower Hamlets is 99% more deprived than all others with 44% of children living in poverty. Tower Hamlets is only 3 miles away from our office. 

The First Love Foundation will be able to use charitable donations to increase operations in line with the surge in demand, as well as buying food in bulk. They will also be able to offer more services like a door-to-door delivery service for the households that are having to isolate and don't have access to essential food and household goods. 

Thank you for any contribution you are able to make. As a reminder, the firm’s Charitable Foundation will match funds raised by the London office up to a maximum of £10,000.

Title: Bramhall Spidey Raising Fund for Chelwood food bank

Description:
Emerge UK is proud to fund-raise on behalf of Trussell Trust.  

Charity Information

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

COVID-19 

It will be no surprise to hear that the coronavirus presents a huge additional pressure to our already overstretched network of food banks, who continue to deal with a record level of need for emergency food. We have already started to see in many of our food banks a reduction in food donations, coupled with a very real shortage of volunteers and on the ground support. We are working closely with our food banks to support them in any way they need, as they face this time of such uncertainty and challenge.  We are focused on rapidly mobilising support so that those most vulnerable to the impacts of poverty and
isolation can survive these months of crisis. As we anticipate a minimum of 400,000 emergency parcels will be supplied over the next three months and we are doing everything we can to establish the infrastructure necessary to enable new food bank delivery models in communities across the UK in response.

Title: LitC Team Challenge 2020 - Food bank collection

Description:
Food banks are, sadly, a necessity for people up and down the country who struggle to afford food and households items that the vast majority of us take for granted. And with the Covid-19 pandemic putting people out of work and having an unthinkable impact on the economy, for those who struggle the most financially, life just got even harder.

My 40th (on 2 April) is going to be a bit of an odd one and I look forward to celebrating it properly with as many of you as possible later in the year. In the meantime, the best birthday present anyone can give me (to replace the lavish gifts you were, of course, planning) is a donation to The Trussell Trust, who support a nationwide network of food banks, provide emergency food and support to people locked in poverty, and campaign for change to end the need for food banks in the UK. A bit more info about their work is at the end of this message.

A pint of my fave beer (Beavertown Gamma Ray, as you asked) is about £6.50 (yes yes, welcome to London in 2020) and so I'm asking everyone to donate the price of a pint to The Trussell Trust instead. 

I'd like to raise £400 if poss and I'll get the ball rolling / beer flowing by making a donation myself.

Thank you for your help. Stay safe and see you soon! 

Cx

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Gibbo's 40th Birthday Food Bank Lockdown Bonanza

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

There is a very real need for Food Banks in the UK with many families relying on them in order to get through the week or month. New figures released in November 2019 shows December 2018 was the busiest month for food banks last year. 186,185 three-day emergency food parcels were provided by food banks in the Trussell Trust’s network to people in crisis; 78,536 of these went to children. 

The monthly average for emergency food parcels provided by food banks within the Trussell Trust network for 2018 was 128,899.

As well as donating food to my local The Trussell Trust food bank I am running the Brighton Half marathon (thats 13 miles, or 21km by the way!!) to help fund this vital charity. My last attempt at this same (or any) half marathon was 7 years ago... I have been training hard this time round, you can see my progress on my dedicated Instagram https://www.instagram.com/smileyrunneruk/. 

I hope to make my family proud and raise as much money as I can for The Trussell Trust! I really appreciate any donation that you can make - thank you in advance :-)

Title: Zoes 312 km  solo cycle for uk food banks

Description:
Hello lovely people,

During these testing and troubling times I think it's more important than ever to look for the positives and what we can do to make a difference. After much deliberation (I have lovely hair!) I have decided to shave my head on 30/3/2020 for charity.

Having spoken to my local food bank they have informed me that donations of essential items are decreasing already, and only expect this to get worse as the pandemic continues and/if more measures are put in place. Over 500 people a month use this service already, with this only likely to increase due to the economic hardships COVID-19 is likely to bring. 

With the supermarkets already practically empty its not hard to imagine the devastating impact this could have.

Any money raised here will be going directly to Harlow Foodbank (Co-ordinated by the Michael Roberts Charitable Trust) to help with running costs, such as logistics and warehousing costs, as well as purchase of essential items (tinned foods, toiletries, fruit juice etc.) which are already at critically low levels.

With everything that is going on at the moment I understand how difficult it may be to donate. As a self-employed DJ, I myself have no work for the foreseeable future, however even a donation of £1 could make a difference. 

Now more than ever its important to look out for people in need.

Thanks for taking the time to read this.

Lash x

Title: YiSA Christmas Jumper Day and Food Bank Appeal 2017

Description:
Please help us raise as much as possible for an excellent cause!

In the London Borough of Tower Hamlets, 48.6% of children live in poverty, and one fifth of households have an annual income of less than £15,000. As winter closes in and bills for heating rise, Christmas can become a time of upset and anxiety.

Since 2012, First Love Foundation have run a Christmas Hamper Appeal – a community effort to enable families and individuals in Tower Hamlets to enjoy the festive season together. Every year, with the help of organisations and local people across the borough, we have put together hundreds of special festive food hampers, as well as toys for children, and gifts for parents. We have also invited families to join us for a Christmas celebration, to receive these gifts and have festive fun together.

Last year, they supported over 450 people through the appeal – none of which would have been possible without donations from hundreds of individuals and organisations like you.

This year, Love at Christmas aims to be bigger than ever before and reach more people who are facing crisis. At this event there will be a Christmas lunch, entertainment and gifts for all the families, couples and single people invited. We will also be delivering food hampers and gifts to young people across the borough who are resident in hostels and might otherwise be isolated from friends and families.

All money raised will go directly to the charity to allow them to distribute hampers to those who need it most, from those who attend the Tower Hamlets Food bank to isolated residents in local youth hostels.

If you wish to give offline there are collections buckets located in 5NC and 1CP. We are also looking for new toys and toiletries and there will be a drop-off point in 5NC - please contact Matthew Farrell, Tonyia Ramsook, Julian Sampson and/or Tom McConnell for further detail. 

If you would like any more information please contact Amy Ertan, Natalie Plant or Daniela Pinardi.
Title: Barclays's Fundraiser for Christmas Hampers - Tower Hamlets Food Bank

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

Description:
Whilst we can look foreward to break our fast with our families , many of our brothers and sisters around the world are  struggling to find any food to break their fast with . With all the suffering and harships they go through on a daily basis, this is the least we could do for them. 

The Prophet (PBUH) said : " Charity (Sadaqah) extinguishes sin, just as water extinguishes fire"  (Tirmidhi). And together we can reach the target to help provide food packs for those in need , even after Ramadan in sha Allah. 

 May Allah (SWT) accept it from us and reward us in this blessed month of Ramadan and keep our brothers and sisters safe and sound.

Islamic Help is a UK-registered charity delivering sustainable solutions that empower people in need. Their work is underpinned by their core values – honesty, transparency, integrity and accountability. Since launch, they have empowered over 10 million people worldwide.Over the past 17 years they have provided urgent aid and sustainable relief to thousands of disadvantaged people across the globe, including right here in the UK.
Title: Food Packs

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.

As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Sean's Sean gets shorn

Description:
Every year at Christmas, The Salvation Army in Openshaw provides toys and gifts for families who struggling financially. We recognise that has been a very difficult year for so many people. 

We provide for a number of local families. Much of this is only possible because of the overwhelming generosity of the general public.  Each year we receive donations of toys, food and money and we are  extremely grateful.

Any gift, however small or large will be very much appreciated. Thank you.

The Salvation Army is a Christian Church & registered Charity working in 130 countries worldwide and is one of the largest and most diverse providers of social welfare in the world. In the UK and Republic of Ireland this work includes more than 800 Salvation Army social service centres and community churches. We provide unconditional friendship, support and very practical help to people in crisis and need and work with children, homeless people, all adult victims of modern slavery and those dealing with drug and/or alcohol addiction.
Title: Openshaw Salvation Army Food Bank COVID - 19 Response

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I am on day two of quarantine, and the government has released its new guidance on social distancing, restrictions on public life and advice on avoiding infection.

I am already missing patisserie, proper coffees, and posh tea in lovely little cafes.  Now, obviously, I am well aware that this is the absolute definition of a spoiled cow problem.  There are millions of people who never had that option.  And now, they are struggling for pasta, for rice, for the basics of feeding their families, more than ever.  People using food banks can't stockpile.  They can't pay inflated prices, might not even have the bank account you need for online delivery, let alone be able to afford the fees.  People will suffer when they have to pull their children out of school and the free hot lunch isn't provided to their home.  This is going to be very bad for far too many people.

The Trussell Trust is the largest food bank charity in the UK.

Every time I desperately, desperately want a proper coffee and a little cake, I will donate the money here instead.  I would be delighted if you felt able to do the same.  

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

Description:
The Salvation Army is a Christian Church & registered Charity working in 130 countries worldwide and is one of the largest and most diverse providers of social welfare in the world. In the UK and Republic of Ireland this work includes more than 800 Salvation Army social service centres and community churches. We provide unconditional friendship, support and very practical help to people in crisis and need and work with children, homeless people, all adult victims of modern slavery and those dealing with drug and/or alcohol addiction.

In Basildon, we've been active as a Church and serving the community for just over 50 years (even longer in Laindon and Pitsea), including through the provision of practical support in times of need. In recent days our foodbank has seen a spike in usage and individuals are finding it difficult to get out of the house to donate food. We've set up this page so that people can make a monetary donation which can be used to purchase food.

Description:
Whilst most of us have felt the impact of C-19 in some way or other, alhamdulillah for the most part, we still have food on the table and a shelter over our heads. Unfortunately, for many millions of people across the globe, the effects of the pandemic are far worse and people are being driven further into poverty and food insecurity than before.

As we enter the last 10 nights of Ramadan, I have decided to appeal to my friends and family to support my fundraising efforts to provide food to those most in need.

As with every major disaster since 1984, Islamic Relief has been responding where the need is the greatest, the covid-19 appeal is no different and IR is present on the ground, delivering all of our donations. 

Please help me reach my target with your zakat, sadaqa or lillah contributions. 

May the blessings of the beautiful month be upon you, and may you be rewarded for your intentions and ability to give - Ameen. 

Peace & Love

Ayesha

Description:
Islamic Help provides food security for tens of thousands of families in need across the world during Ramadan and throughout the year.

Already struggling to survive, their needs are accentuated during this blessed month when they might not have even basic foodstuffs for suhoor and iftar. Your support means the poorest and most vulnerable can share in the blessings of this precious month by having sufficient nutrition and by not having to worry about opening or closing their daily fast with. Not only during Ramadan but after as well Islamic Help will continue to provide food to those in need.


"Those who in charity spend of their goods by night and by day, in secret and in public, have their reward with their Lord: on them shall be no fear, nor shall they grieve"  Qur’an 2:274

  • £35 - Donate a food pack to those in need in Bangladesh, Rohingya, Cameroon or Central African Republic.
  • £50 - Donate a food pack to those in need in Pakistan, Tanzania, or for Palestinian/Syrian refugees in Jordan.
  • £70 - Donate a food pack to those in need in Yemen or Gaza

Please look deep in your heart and donate!

Description:
Supporting our UK communities through donations

Many Citi colleagues want to help people affected by COVID-19, whether that’s NHS workers or vulnerable members of the community.  As a result, Citi UK is matching employee donations to a number of charities on the frontline, up to a maximum of £100,000.

South Belfast Food Bank provides nutritionally balanced emergency food and support to local people in crisis. They are part of a nationwide network of foodbanks, supported by The Trussell Trust, working to combat poverty and hunger across the UK.

Donations will enable South Belfast Food Bank and others in Northern Ireland to receive larger bulk buy from wholesalers to provide more support to those who need it the most.

Any
questions, please contact VolunteerLondon@citi.com
Title: Citi UK COVID-19 Response: Northern Irish Food Banks

Description:
We’re shut in and fed up, but at least we’ve got chicken goujons and Cornettos. This whole pandemic nonsense will hit those on low to no incomes the hardest and, right now, it’s tricky enough to find some of life’s essentials in the shops when you can afford them.

So as I sat here at home, unravelling at the prospect of being on lockdown, stuck inside, having to move house and have building work done in the midst of all of this, I realised I was being a bit of a whiny bitch. So, in a not entirely selfless effort to take back some control and maybe put a Kit-kat in a hungry mouth, I’ve decided to buzz off my hair for charity.

Specifically, The Trussell Trust, who support a nationwide network of food banks, including one in Cheltenham. Coronavirus has made food banks even more necessary for some people, so I thought they were a good recipient of the hair money. It’s like blood money but scratchier. 

I’ve never buzzed my hair off before, and I’m fairly sure I’ll look ridiculous, so there’s your incentive. I’ll live stream the removal of my distinguished locks and may well get my daughter to do the deed as she’ll no doubt find it hilarious and will be able to reach the back better.

Target’s £500. More would be amazing though, and super helpful for a really important charity. I dunno, maybe I’ll dream up some stretch goal rewards or something if we break the target. Time and date of The Buzzening to be announced as and when/if the mark is hit. If it isn’t hit, well, we’ll see. And I say buzz rather than shave because I’m not pulling a razor across my bonce. I don’t want a shiny head.
Title: Socially Distancing My Hair From My Head For Food Banks.

Description:
The coronavirus is having an unprecedented impact on the number of people needing our services. We have had an almost 110% increase in referrals and numbers are increasing week on week, but our stocks are getting low. We are working in partnership with Tunbridge Wells Borough Councils COVID Response Team to make sure that no one in crisis goes without food during this difficult time.

We have decided, as a family, to cycle 260 miles in a week as part of the 2.6 challenge. We are keen to support our local food bank who do such a fantastic job supporting the local community.
Title: Team Brookbank cycle 260 miles

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

We were being creative at home and hearing all the terrible COVID-19 stories, we wrote this song in hopes to keep everyone positive during such a dire time. We want to spread the message of hope and for everyone to stay home in order to protect the NHS until we can go back to normality.

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: Breathe Again Song for COVID-19

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Description:
The coronavirus epidemic has made it extremely hard for the those on the breadline. More and more people have less and there is less food being donated to food banks as the economy shrinks. This is sadly pushing more and more people into poverty.  

Annabelle and Ollie really love their food ;o) so thought this was the best way to help others at this challenging time. They couldn't bear the thought that other children might not get chocolate over Easter, so we thought this way maybe they will. 

Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year. Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure. We're working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that they're able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: Annabelle and Ollie's 100km bike ride to help others

Description:
Bank of Scotland colleagues across Greenock, Port Glasgow & Dunoon are raising money for ‘Inverclyde action community response group’. 

With the majority of our key workers living locally we want to play our part in supporting those in the community in desperate need. After various conversations with this charity we have decided to raise as much money as possible to support their ongoing efforts of delivering hot meals throughout Inverclyde. 

What will we be doing? 

Monday 18th May -  Sunday 24th May 

As a team we will walk, run or cycle 520km per day for 7 days. This is 1km for every hot meal currently being delivered in Inverclyde each day by volunteers. 

In total over the week we will cover 3640 km which across all participating  colleagues is roughly 13km each per day. 

Each colleague can apply for match funding of up to £500 individually so the more we raise as a team the more we can claim from Bank of Scotland. 

Why Salvation Army? 

The Port Glasgow Salvation Army are supporting Inverclyde action community group which has been set up during Covid 19 to support the most vulnerable in Inverclyde. The charity are expecting the demand for hot meals to increase from 520 per day to 800 with an expected cost over 90 days of more than £50,000. This charity is also delivering isolation boxes full of necessities to those isolating, vulnerable and financially impacted during these really difficult times. 

With so many of our colleagues living locally we are extremely passionate about our community and want to do as much as we can to support an amazing cause. 

Thank you in advance from all of us at your local Bank of Scotland branch. Stay safe !
Title: Bank of Scotland Inverclyde - Covid 19

Description:
Akuma Beavers are back again for lockdown fun and games. On our last quiz we saw over 130 people tune in and raise money for shooting star children's hospices(SSC), bringing up a total of over £7000 now from our games nights.

Even tho Boris has eased lockdown rules a little we still want to kick off your bank holiday with a bang ! games night kicking off @ 8pm on Friday the 22nd of May. It’s been a while since we’ve all been “out out” so this is our theme for the next quiz , dress to impress splash on the lynx Africa , whack on the fake eye lashes and dust off those 👠 

For those who don't know SSC, they are a charity that care for babies & children with life limiting conditions and end of life care. Covid-19 has put significant pressure on SSC and they have had to close one of their two hospices. Lets do our part whilst having a ball by donating as little as £10!


3 easy steps to get involved

1. Donate on here with your name

2. Download Zoom app

3. Receive code from me ( make sure you put your name when donating)


Cant wait to see you all for another great evening for an amazing cause.


Thanks & safe wishes


Alex

Description:
Assalamu'alaikum warahmatullahi wabarakatuh my dearestbrothers and sisters,I am fundraising for those who do not have the privilege of having food on the table.

Indeed, those who practice charity have loaned Allah goodly loan; it will be multiplied for them and they will have a noble reward” - Holy Qur’an (57:18)".

If we put ourselves in the shoes for those who are less needy, after a long fast they wouldn't have anything on their table to break their fast with but YOU can change that. A simple small donation means a lot to those who seriously need it and a lot to me as well as I've always wanted to help people around me as I feel as if I haven't done enough for wider community. As the prophet said: Charity does not decrease wealth, let's focus on the third pillar of Islam, multiply our rewards, excel and be the best person we can be! 

Thank you for your time ❤️

SubhanAllah we've all felt the effects of Coronavirus. Many of us have struggled with sickness or day-to-day life in isolation, and sadly many have lost loved ones. Around the world, there's a global food shortage due to supplies being disrupted by Coronavirus. Families living in poverty in places like Gaza, Somalia and Syria don't have the luxury of stockpiling food.This is why we're calling on YOU to help keep vulnerable people around the people safe during the blessed month of Ramadan and take on the challenge to help feed just ONE FAMILY this Ramadan by fundraising for one food pack, which costs just £50.
Title: Behroze's campaign to feed families who are less fortunate!

Description:
Rotherham (Kimberworth) Salvation Army is one of the few food banks in the Rotherham "Food in Crisis" Partnership that has been able to keep operating from day 1 of the Covid-19 pandemic lockdown. Our partnership is co-ordinated by Voluntary Action Rotherham, and supported by Yorkshire Fareshare. 

Our operation consists of just two people, yet we have been able to source, prepare and deliver over 100 food parcels direct to the door of families in need. There are many more families on our waiting list, but we are struggling to keep pace with the growing levels of need, as our stock of food and household supplies is constantly being exhausted in these extremely challenging times. 

Despite fantastic support from Fareshare and local supermarkets, including Morrisons and Aldi, the supply of donated food is simply not able to meet the demand as we seek to support the practical needs of individuals and families in the Rotherham area, across a wide spectrum of people, ranging from some of the most vulnerable members of our community, to those who are self-isolating, as well as hard-working families who have seen their livelihoods evaporate overnight.

Consequently, we are now having to resort to queuing up at the local supermarket several times a week in order to purchase additional food and household supplies, just to keep up with the demand.

Please give what you can to enable us to help as many people as possible!
Title: Rotherham Salvation Army COVID-19 Crisis Response - Food Bank Fund

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.

As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Description:
Orphans and widows are the most vulnerable members in society and face so many difficult challenges in their day to day lives.

Who can be more deserving of our support and help than a child who has no one. Let us give hope to children and widows who need our support more than ever. Lets donate and remind them they are not alone. 

A food parcel is a valuable lifeline when a family loses the breadwinner of the house to an accident, disease or even murder. How else would a widow feed herself and her family when she has no money and no resources?

For just £30, that’s around a third of your average weekly shopping bill, we can feed a family of five for an entire month.

Orphans in Need provides food parcels to help widows and orphans affected by poverty. Many widows in the fourteen countries we work in across throughout Asia and Africa, rely on your generosity to feed their families month by month.

When you donate to help someone, Allah will always give you more in return and put barakah into everything in your life.

 If you use what Allah has blessed you with to help others, Allah will always have your back.

By giving and supporting orphans, Allah is answering their duas through you.

⭐

Title: Shaving Ben's head to raise much needed funds for the Trussell Trust food banks.

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

AN ABSOLUTE MUST HAVE FOR ANY PATRIOTIC SCOTTISH DOG!

OK, fair enough. This is a bit nuts. A lot nuts actually. See the picture of the blue football shirt? Well, it ain't just any football shirt. It is a Scotland shirt for the discerning, patriotic smaller Scottish dog. Believe it or not we have had forty of these donated and they are all in serious need of a good home.

Well in a few days time Scotland will be taking on the Auld Enemy at Wembley and your wee pooch must be desperate to wear the colours. So here's the good news. If you were to give any kind of donation to this page one of these canine shirts might just find its way to you in the post so long as you give me a bell on 077770 443483 to sort it out.

Yeah, I know. But these are times when frontline charities like First Base need to clutch at every straw we can find!

ABOUT ME LIVING OFF ONE OF OUR FOOD PARCELS.

I really don't want to make any kind of big deal out of what I'm doing here! I guess in a way I am about to put my money where my mouth is. In September I will live off one of the First Base Agency's emergency food parcels for half a week. 

Check out the picture above. I know. It isn't going to be so very hard, right?. And it shouldn't be so very hard. All of us at First Base are pretty proud of the emergency food parcels we have been handing out for the last 13 years. We are very much aware that the REALLY hard part of living off emergency food is being in a position where you NEED to live off emergency food. It is a very bleak place indeed to find yourself in. We see this every single day in the eyes of those who come into First Base.

I am lucky. I don't need emergency food. Not right now at least. So I am not asking for your support for any kind of recognition of me doing something remotely difficult. Instead I am asking for support for something much more profound. Over the coming eight months of winter over 3000 people will come through the doors of First Base. Each and every one of them will be in the miserable position of finding themselves unable to buy food to eat. And we will all do our very best to make sure each and every person who comes to us will leave the building with a bag full of the kind of food I am about to live off for a few days.

But there is a problem. A pretty big problem. As I write these words we have enough funding in place to just about keep the doors open until the end of December. Then nothing. January nothing. February nothing. March nothing. Three long, cold winter months when hundreds and hundreds of people will need us to be there to provide emergency food.

Sadly this is a problem we are only too familiar with. Every frontline charity in Britain knows how it is to live on the edge of a funding cliff. It is hard and it is stressful. Our local community is utterly amazing when it comes to donating food. Last year we received over £40,000's worth. When I spend my three days eating emergency food I will be lucky enough to have a fresh loaf of bread donated by Greggs and a pack of ham donated by Brown Brothers. The list of our food donors is a long one and we feel honoured to be supported by so many.

However the bags of food that arrive every day will never pay our electric bill. Or the phone bill. Or the rent. Or wages. Or the detailed accounts we are legally and rightly obliged to produce for the charity regulator. Or fuel in the tank to deliver made up food parcels to the 20 collection points we bow have across the region.

These are the boring bills which cover the nuts and bolts of keeping the doors of any front line charity open. They are boring but unavoidable. And the money to cover these boring bills is our life blood. By hook or by crook we need to find £20,000 before the end of March to ensure our doors stay open. It won't be easy. Anything but. However it is a situation we are only too familiar with. We have faced down this kind of funding crisis many times over the last 13 years and we are confident of doing so again. Never once have we turned away a single person who has come to us for emergency food. Not once. We're all pretty proud of that record and we have no intention of allowing such a thing to happen in the coming winter.

So. How can you help? Well there are two options. Of course you can donate a few quid on this page and if you do so we will be hugely appreciative. Or maybe you might want to go a stage further and do exactly what I am doing - live off a First Base emergency food parcel for half a week and raise so cash either with a page like this one or by using more traditional sponsorship forms. So how would that work? Easy. You can call me on either 07770 443483 or 01387 279680 or you can e mail me at markglenmill@aol.com. I will then deliver you a three day food parcel and sponsorship forms should you need any. Tell you what. I'll throw in a full signed set of my back list of books as a thank you. Then it is a case of eating emergency food for three days and chasing in a few donations. 

So that's that I guess. Please support us either by donating to this page or by starting up a page of your own. Maybe I will see you soon with a box of food and a bag of books!

All the best

Mark
Title: I'm raising cash to make sure the First Base food bank survives the winter

Description:
For the past three years FAST UK has helped to finance an emergency food bank for some of the poorest people and families living in the Rroma village called Apalina on the outskirts of Reghin. So far the charity has helped to feed over 200 families but we would love to help more!

After a past visit we were asked for some help by Pastor Attila Toth who informed us that many families within this village were trying to survive on just one or two small meals per week. In the summer months it is possible for families to survive on gleanings from locally grown crops but in winter with temperatures often dropping to as low as -32 degrees centigrade with snow on the floor this makes this way of living almost impossible.

With the money raised on this page as a charity we will send money to Attila so that he is able to purchase good basic food locally in Reghin. All of the food purchased will be given out to the most needy families according to the need. 

On a recent visit this summer that I was on Attila told one of our trustees that the funds provided over the past few years have enabled people to have enough to eat through the harsh winters and in a few cases even prevent people from starving to death. After seeing the people living within the village in September 2017 and hearing many families stories, I feel very passionate about helping them and would love you to as well!

Currently the total we send to the food bank is £1500.00 per year but we would love to send more if possible so more people can be helped. The £1500.00 we give feeds approx 200 through the long winters which amounts to about £10 per person to see them through the whole winter period. This money not only enables people to eat but also to have a much easier time throughout the winter months as this is often the hardest time for families living in such a difficult environment and with so little. 

Can you help some on eat well this winter for just £10?

If you can help then that would be fantastic, remember no matter how much you can donate, every pound helps to feed a person for a day, week, month and winter.

Title: Adele Moss's Birthday

Description:
In Short

We are five students at St. Edwards Oxford and our goal is to live off of £1.50 each day for three days in order to a) raise awareness for just how difficult it is to live below the poverty line and b) to raise money for the Oxford Food Bank. We intend to raise £500 pounds and we appreciate any donations big or small.

Thank you in advance from Clare, Jackson, Zak, Will and Natalia  :-)

Some Things To Keep In Mind...

  • . "In October 2015, the World Bank updated the international poverty line to $1.90 (£1.50) a day. The new figure of $1.90 is based on ICP purchasing power parity (PPP) calculations and represents the international equivalent of what $1.90 ((£1.50) could buy in the US in 2011." - Wikipedia
  •  An estimated 1.4 billion people worldwide face this exact challenge daily.

So What does £1.50 Include?

Well Our aim is that our 1.50 budget for each day will include all main meals and any needs other than water. This includes any form of food, toiletries (e.g toothpaste, body wash, soap, toilet paper ) and any other things that we may need to buy during the course of the next three days! Of course most of our budgets will be geared towards food so we will have to drop much of the so called necessities that we consume in our normal lifestyles!

Meal Diary

Day 1: 

Breakfast = --nuthin--

Lunch = Oven baked chips, rice, Fried egg and baked beans.

Dinner = Oven baked chips, Egg Fried Rice (or an attempt at it...)                                      and baked beans

Check Our Gallery And Update Feed For More! Or Follow Us On Instagram at @livingatthepovertyline

Title: Hannah Bond & James Baldwin's Wedding

Description:
After four years at Rice, you may not have always loved Houston. But like me, you probably have some space in your heart for it, in all its sprawling, diverse, concrete, cultural, foodie glory. And it's heartbreaking to watch it flood; to watch families flee their homes, to watch so many lose so much. As a former (or current) part of the Houston community, we thought it would be good to give a space for Rice alumni (and friends) to help keep #HoustonStrong. 

The Houston Food Bank is a part of the local community, meaning that your donation will reach those in need more quickly. It comes highly vetted by Charity Navigator (four stars) and is recommended by Houston natives. Your support will help local residents in the weeks and months to come, as they begin the long process of pulling their lives together after devastating losses. If the food bank is not your thing, please donate to another great local organisation, from diaper banks to the Montrose Center, Baker Ripley, or local animal shelters, who could use your support. 

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. They do take a small fee - 5% - but I am looking into ways of having this cost covered by a matched donation to the organisation. 

I may have been overly ambitious in my target, but I know my fellow Owls are generous (and like 27% of you are lawyers, so)

*makes weird owl symbol with fingers that only you guys get*,

Caroline Glendenning-Platt, Hanszen '04
Title: Owls for Houston

Description:

Description: Starting on the 27th I'm running 5km every other day for 30 days to support food banks which are one of many groups which need our help and support in these challenging times. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Description:
Thank you for arriving here for a read!

Last year I booked with Global Adventure Challenges to climb Ben Nevis in June 2019. In September 2018 I started losing weight to get myself fit for the challenge (starting weight 299 lbs - goal weight 199 lbs) and am starting the year having already nearly lost 1/2 the weight. 

On this first day of New Year 2019 training starts. While I shift the final 58 lbs to get to my goal to do the challenge, I also have to get myself fit enough to do it. This will involve many months of long walks and steep hills as well as getting my legs stronger in the gym to be able to climb the tallest mountain in the UK. 

BUT this is not only a personal challenge, I really want to help The Trussell Trust food banks here in South Yorkshire. People poverty that leads to food poverty is something that shouldn't be happening in our society. Our children shouldn't be going hungry. 

While we all have to take responsibility for our spending and make sensible choices to look after our loved ones, there are still many people who really struggle to support themselves and their families and reach a crisis point. We need to be helping these people, ensuring we can help support with food and essentials during these critical times.

Please donate to my JustGiving page. I will also be asking my work if we can collect food bank items to bring to The local Trussell Trust food bank in Rotherham on a monthly basis.

Thank you for your support

C xxxxxx

Description:
We exist to ensure that no one in Waterloo goes hungry.

For people on low incomes, a sudden crisis  redundancy, benefit delay, illness or even an unexpected bill  can mean going hungry. Every day parents skip meals to feed their children and people are forced to choose between paying the rent or eating.

Since our launch weve given away over 100 tonnes of food to over 12,500 people in need, including almost 5,000 local children.

We are part of The Trussell Trusts UK-wide foodbank network, and together we provide food to thousands of people nationwide every year. The Foodbank is hosted at the Oasis Centre, St Johns Waterloo and St George the Martyr on behalf of South Bank Churches.

We work with local frontline care professionals, such as schools, charities, housing associations, GPs, health visitors and churches, to identify those in need. They distribute vouchers that the client then exchanges for food. When clients arrive at the Foodbank, we offer them the chance to meet with
Title: Waterloo Foodbank

Title: Food for Syria  (Every penny helps)

Description:
At Tujatane, we refer to ourselves as a
family, and during difficult times, it is important that we keep holding hands
together and support each other as much as possible.

Our students, as well as our ex-pupils sponsored
at secondary school would usually receive two hearty and nutritious meals per
day at school, however due to COVID-19, all schools in Zambia are currently closed.
Usually these meals they have at school are the only meals the children will
have in a day.

The parent and guardians are now having to
provide extra for their families and at such a challenging global financial
time, many families are struggling with this extra burden.

So, seeing as we cannot cook for our
pupils, we would love to distribute food to each pupil to support them and their
families to relieve pressure of having extra food to buy.

For just £4 per student, we can provide the
basic staple foods to our pupils for them to cook with their families at home.  As well as this, we can provide multi-use
soap and handmade, reusable cotton face masks, which are now mandatory at all
times outside of the home.

We would love to continue this for as long
as COVID-19 is affecting the world, and in turn our community here.

Thank you so much for your generosity and
please stay safe and well during this time.
Title: COVID-19 Community Food Relief

Description:
Emma and Harry have been inspired by the story of Captain Tom Moore and wanted to do something to help those around them. They came up with the idea of cycling 200 miles over the next month. This will be a big challenge for little children with little legs, but they are determined and enthusiastic about supporting the Romsey Food Bank  

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year. Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

The coronavirus is having an unprecedented impact on the number of people needing our services. We have had an almost 110% increase in referrals and numbers are increasing week on week, but our stocks are getting low. We are working in partnership with Tunbridge Wells Borough Councils COVID Response Team to make sure that no one in crisis goes without food during this difficult time.

Description:
The last few months have seen immense suffering and hardship from storms and flooding. However the outbreak of the Coronavirus has quite literally changed everyone's lives and turned society upside down. However, The Salvation Army is resolute and strong and just as we did in the Spanish Flu pandemic, and during the bombing and the Blitz we will carry on, doing what we can to support people and communities in the ways that we can, within the Government guidelines. In true Salvation Army Spirit, our greatest strength is our flexible, responsive local presence. Right now, each of our 650 corps and community centres will know exactly what the most effective things are to do. We are not just responding to the virus impact in one or two ways, but dozens and dozens of different ways, from food banks to counselling, from supporting NHS isolation units to checking up on people who are living alone. Please give what you can to enable us to help as many people as possible!

Hastings Temple Salvation Army is collecting donations to buy food for vulnerable people in our community who are struggling during the coronavirus pandemic.
Title: The Salvation Army Hastings Temple (Ore)

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Covid 19 food aid #LockdownHairCut4Charity

Easiest and smartest hair cut under lockdown - keep you looking fresh, healthy and clean.

Lockdown challenge, shave your hair, take a selfie and post it with hashtag #LockdownHairCut4Charity and donate £10 you save, or more if you are able for our UK food aid fund.

100% donation policy*please see below

The money will be used to provide food and other basic needs of pensioners, disabled, ill people, NHS frontline workers, refugees and families with children suffering hunger in lockdown.

Millions of children are going hungry or are malnourished in Britain today because their parent’s income has been cut. Pensioners and disabled under lockdown can’t afford food because they can no longer access cheap deals Thousands of NHS staff and other essential frontline workers who have become infected by Covid 19 need our help in isolation.

Raise additional donations by getting family and friends to sponsor your #LockdownHairCut4Charity

Ladies you can donate the cost of a wash+cut when you forego in solidarity.

Please join us to help people during Covid 19 crisis. Most food banks report having run out of basic food items.

Who is Sultana Foundation?

We are a grassroots UK registered foundation who have been giving food aid to vulnerable refugee women and children living in the infamous Moria refugee camp in Lesbos, Greece. It’s Europe’s biggest and worst refugee camp, which was initially build to house 2800, yet today over 20000 live there in squalid over-crowded conditions.

The coronavirus pandemic has massively increased the need for food aid here at home and we want to help. We have over 4 years hands on experience in helping the neediest.

*100% donation policy. Every penny you donate goes towards helping the needy. No one is on our payroll. We are all self-funded volunteers.

www.sultanafoundation.co.uk  "one humanity"
www.facebook.com/sulanafoundation.co.uk

Description:
Hi and welcome to my 2020 Ramadan fundraiser.

For the last ten days of Ramadan and the rest of May I'm raising money for Penny Appeal to provide life-saving food to Kashmiri families in need. Your donations will ease the suffering of the people of Southern Kashmir, which has been identified as the most affected zone in the valley.

Kashmir is a beautiful province that not many of the Western world know much about.

The Kashmiri conflict between India and Pakistan has been ongoing since 1947. The two countries have disputed over ownership of land for decades. It was expected to go to Pakistan. It's Hindu ruler at the time wanted to stay independent but, faced with an invasion of Muslim tribes from Pakistan, acceded to India later that year in return for protection.

Since then India and Pakistan have fought over the territory.

Authorities have consistently violated basic human rights of the Kashmiri people. Military interventions have consistently disrupted the peace of the region, resulting in homelessness, shortage of food and lack of medicine.

The governments have been offering rehabilitation to those who joined militant ranks and crossed over to other side of Kashmir, but have no program for the return or rehabilitation of civilians, who had to abandon homes, fearing an outbreak of war.

The Food Packs of Penny Appeal include rice, sugar, flour, oil, lentils, tea, beans and spices, which will stop Kashmiri families from going hungry, and give them comfort in the midst of this crisis.

Together we can raise even a small amount of funds that can contribute to making a big difference in helping the endangered people of Kashmir.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Mic's Ramadan Aid for Kashmir

Description:
InTouch Foundation, Covid-19, Emergency food Provision

Covid-19 has had a major impact on individuals and their families. With a reduction in income combined with the lock down it has become increasingly difficult for many families to provide meals to their loved ones.

InTouch Foundation will be distributing ready meals to children and families in need. Partnering with local grassroots organisations to help distribute meals where the need is the greatest. Each meal costs £2.20 we are expecting to distribute over 30,000 meals in the coming weeks.

Please donate generously
Title: Bradford Jiu Jitsu Club  Covid 19 emergency food provision

Description:
InTouch Foundation is a small grassroots charity which has been working with the homeless and vulnerable people of Bradford, Keighley, Huddersfield and beyond since 2012

Our ethos has always been to provide much needed support to those in need whilst upholding dignity and respect.

We look to the example of Prophet Muhammad (saw) for guidance in fulfilling our duties as Muslims, we are reminded of the need to help others who lack even the daily essentials we enjoy, but may take for granted. The Prophet (saw) said:
‘None of you have faith until you love for your neighbour what you love for yourself.’ 

Most recently, with the Covid-19 pandemic we have adapted our services to ensure we are still providing this essential service.

Due to loss of jobs, reduction in income many families have been unable to feed themselves or their loved ones.

InTouch Foundation will be distributing ready meals to children and families in need. Partnering with local grassroots organisations to help distribute meals where the need is the greatest.

Each meal costs ONLY £2.20.

We are expecting to distribute over 30,000 meals in the next few weeks. 

I would like to raise money for 500 of these!


Please help us to help those most in need
Title: Masira's journey to feed Yorkshire!

Description:
Friends,

Thank you for taking the time to visit my fundraising page for Urban Community Projects, a charity which provides an array of activities - food deliveries, job training, mentoring, financial coaching - to members of our community who are most in need. I recently signed up to volunteer for one of Urban Community Projects' initiatives, the Camden Mobile Food Bank, to deliver food donations to vulnerable families who live on local estates. I signed up for the initiative because of 2 major reasons:

1) More so than ever, this is a time when the recipients really need our help as many of them, be it the elderly or ill, are confined to their homes and are unable to collect the food parcels themselves.  

2) I myself have been fortunate enough to be a recipient of other people's generosity of time and financial resources, and I know from firsthand experience that a small act of kindness has the power to make a significant difference to another individual's life. To the extent that I am able to, I would like to keep this 'cycle of generosity' alive.

I am appealing to you because alongside my volunteering to deliver food, I have created a page to help raise funds for Urban Community Projects so that the charity is able to continue carrying out essential services to vulnerable members of our community, at a time when it is most needed. If you are able to, I ask that you please donate through the Just Giving  website to support Urban Community Projects.

I will match your donations by committing to doing as many food delivery trips as I can possibly squeeze in outside of my work hours.  

Thank you in advance.
Sello
Title: A Helping Hand

Description:
Save the UK's CharitiesGeneral fundraising has been hit very hard by the COVID-19 pandemic. Thousands of fundraising events have been cancelled and many charities, particularly smaller ones, are struggling to maintain services because of this huge reduction in income.This impacts all sectors of society from children to the elderly as well as the vital work in areas such as palliative care, serious diseases, mental health, housing support, food supplies and countless others that charities support.

So on the 26th of April people have been challenged to do an event based on 26.2 mile of the 40th London Marathon,  a 2.6 mile run was suggested,  but as I run further than that most days, and I have too much spare time, I have devised my own challenge. 

Starting at 0540, l will, do the following:

26 hill reps on the hill behind our house

26 press ups

26 squat thrusts

26 sit ups

26 reverse dips

26 mins on the turbo trainer

26 seal crawls the length of the garden eating a Maltese at the turn around point, no hands.

Being sick
Title: My 2.6 Challenge

Description:
So I don’t normally advertise my birthday, but it’s this month and although I know how important just staying home is, I still feel like I should be doing something to help right now. So, if you would’ve sent me a Bday card, gone out for a drink or lunch or whatever, I’d love it if you could donate to the Trussel trust instead. So many families are struggling and hopefully this will go towards helping a few of them out. Thank you all!

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: My bday

Description:
On 1st May 2020, Smith Goodfellow celebrated 40 years in business. It's a huge milestone for us, especially given the current global pandemic and the impact it's having on small businesses like ours around the world.  Because community is one of the most important things to us as a business, and a team, we want to celebrate by giving back. Over the next 12 months, we will be undertaking 40 good deeds, big and small, to support our local community, other businesses and charities close to our hearts. 

We're kicking off by walking, running, cycling and dancing 400 miles in 40 days to raise money for The Trussell Trust. This is not your usual sponsored walk/cycle/run because several members of the team are self isolating - we're going to be getting creative and completing our miles in all sorts of ways, including exercise bikes, step machines! 

We've chosen to support The Trussell Trust for this because we want to support the vital service that they offer. More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year. Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure. The Trussell Trust are working closely with their network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how each food bank can be best supported in the coming months to make sure that they're able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Anything you can give to help this worthy cause will make a difference. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for being part of our 40 year journey and for helping us give back to communities across the UK. We hope you are staying safe and well.
Title: Smith Goodfellow's 400 for 40

Description: Last year, food banks in The Trussell Trust network ( there are more than 1200 in the UK ) provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. In 2020 as the Covid 19 situation unfolds the importance of Food banks is increasing. For more information please read trusselltrust.org

Description:
The Trussell Trust is helping to support food banks across the UK (73 in London), as well as providing emergency food to those most in need during the Coronavirus crisis. Food banks are experiencing a huge increase in demand as more vulnerable people turn to them for help through COVID-19. 

“Food banks face an unprecedented challenge in the coming months. As the coronavirus outbreak unfolds, more people are likely to need emergency food at exactly the same time as fewer volunteers are able to help. The resilience of food banks is nothing short of outstanding, and we’re working closely with our network to help ensure that wherever possible, people unable to afford the essentials can access help. But this is not easy."

Hines in London will be fundraising to support the Trussell Trust continue their essential work with societies most vulnerable during this difficult time. 

We appreciate your support.

Title: Anne's Operation Kids Breakfast Cereal

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

A couple of years ago, I was lucky enough to have the members of the Australian metal band Ne Obliviscaris to sign an electro-acoustic violin we used for the violin player with my own band. I had a plan to start collecting a large number of memorabilia to do a big charity campaign & raffle.

Unfortunately, Time/Life got in the way a bit, so the collection wasn't quite as large as I would have liked. A few items have gone 100% sale price to charity on ebay already, and about £250 has been raised so far.

The violin, however, will be Raffled as opposed to auctioned, because I believe it is far more likely to sell 100 tickets @ £5 each than one person willing to spend £500 at auction

Terms & conditions - by donating / entering the raffle, you confirm you agree to the following:

1 - All donations of multiples of £5 will count as 1 raffle ticket. (e.g. £25 donation = 5 tickets).

2 - You MUST tick the box to "share your information" in order to enter - without donor details, I have no way of contacting them to arrange the delivery.

3 - I will print off the raffle tickets and live stream the cutting, folding, entering into a bag and drawing a winner, for complete transparency.

4 - The winner will be notified by email & on Facebook. I will pay for INTERNATIONAL shipping myself. If the winner does not respond within 14 days to the contact attempts, a new Winner will be drawn,

5 - The Winner will receive the violin. However, should they wish to part with the violin, they do NOT have authorisation to sell it for a Profit. Should they wish to auction / raffle for Charity, that is OK, however if they attempt to sell the violin for a personal profit / trade (etc) or accept any goods, services or personal renumeration for the Violin, then I reserve the right to request it's return. a refund of the raffle price (£5) will be offered in such circumstances, which I will pay myself.

6 - The violin is being raffled as musical memorabilia, not as a musical instrument. Although it is playable, and the electrinics do work.
Title: Oliver's Trussell Trust raffle - violin signed by Ne Obliviscaris

Title: In Celebration of the Memory of Dan Hunty

Description:
Beatles 4 Food 2019

Rock n Roller and all round nice guy Trev
“Prellie” Townsend did a few charity gigs around Christmas in the early 2000’s.  Things seemed to be going well but with the recent political and socioeconomic issues facing the average
person in the UK Trev felt he had to get back in to action.

Food banks his target, The Trussell Trust his chosen charity. The Trussell Trust guide and support the people opening and running food banks to ensure all legal elements are covered and other support.

The Trust also fights the government aiming to make food banks extinct! Yes, this would mean the Trussell Trust would have to cease business… And nothing would make them happier!

So December 8th 2018 was the first Beatles 4 Food, a daytime event in The Barcelona, Liverpool. The bands and venue were booked and ready to go, then in the October, tragically and
suddenly at 52, Trev passed away causing devastation to his family and friends alike.  However the show must go on and
his band mates picked up the mantel and the gig went ahead raising a massive £4500 for the Trust.

Unfortunately the use of food banks has risen and help is still needed:

In terms of their last full year of stats though, between 1 April 2018 and 31 March 2019, the Trussell Trust’s food bank network
distributed 1.6 million three-day emergency food supplies to people in crisis, a 19% increase on the previous year.

We desperately need your help in raising money to
support the Trussell Trust, who in turn support food banks

Now we originally was going to ask everyone to bring a pantry item to the church on the big day as they are a collection point but instead I thought if guests could donate a small amount of 50p or £1 then wouldnt have to turn up in your finest wedding gear clutching a tin a of beans xx

Title: Jane's Sponsor me to Fast for 24 hours - all money goes to Foodbanks

Description:
I am doing some work with food banks and vulnerable client groups, including cooking on a budget and eating more healthily. I am overweight and so feel I should practice what I preach!

 I am dismayed at how many people in Britain in 2015 are having to queue at food banks for 3 day's worth of basic food. These numbers are set to soar again with further planned cuts and "reforms" to benefits. I decided it was time to make a financial contribution to The Trussell Trust and am doing this in order to do just that.

I will be losing weight, changing my diet and swimming twice a week over the course of the next 7 months. I will be finishing this challenge on 01/12/15. 

December isn't a happy month for anyone struggling to feed themselves, especially with Christmas being so heavily commercialised., Whether  you have a religion you follow or not it's  difficult not to feel the pinch when everyone else seems to be spending lots and eating well, so I felt December would be a good time to give my contribution.

Above is the obligatory  "before " picture. 

My starting  weight is 16 stone and 7 lbs or 104.8tkg   I'll  be doing a monthly weigh in at a Boots and uploading pics of the print outs to prove I'm  losing weight from now until December. First  one to be uploaded soon. Watch this space!
