Description: Galvanised by the belief that being clean is not a luxury or a privilege, The Hygiene Bank is a registered, people powered, grassroots charity grounded in community. We collect and re-distribute donated toiletries, hygiene, beauty and personal care items to UK charities, voluntary organisations and schools. These in turn are then given for free to their beneficiaries. Our passion stems from a sense of injustice: it's not right that anyone should face hygiene poverty in modern Britain.
Title: Thbluton Just Giving Page

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

My name is Alice. I am nine years old  and I live in Bishop's Stortford . Like most children I am home from school, this upsets me because it means I can't visit my grandparents in the Easter holidays which I was looking forward to doing. Instead I have decided to virtually cycle to them in April, starting with Nanny in Bishop's Stortford and finishing with Grandmaman and Grandpa in Dorset. This means cycling, on our exercise bike, about 7k every day throughout April to make it up to 206k to reach Dorset by the end of the month. I have decided to do this to keep active and raise money for the Bishop's Stortford food bank, as I feel they will need donations even more so during this outbreak.

Description:
Amidst the Coronavirus crisis, the people of Milton Keynes are in dire need of our local foodbank more than ever before. Whole families in previously secure jobs have suddenly found themselves thrust into poverty and struggling to put food on the table, through no fault of their own. And the worst is yet to come. 

The foodbank is struggling to meet demand, with food packages going out as soon as the donations come in.

The people of MK need your help now more than ever. I know finances are tight for all of us right now, but please if you can spare even a small amount, you'll be making a big difference right now!

My goal is to cycle 200 miles over the next 30 days, in order to help raise funds, support and feed those in need. Please, let's all chip in to help those who are really in a desperate place right now...

Many pupils, staff and families from Holmewood House have been wanting to get involved in some way to help our wider community during these difficult and uncertain times of COVID-19.

Nourish is a registered charity that provides short-term emergency provisions, support and signposting in a crisis to individuals and families within the borough of Tunbridge Wells, South Tonbridge and the surrounding areas.

Their  mission is that no-one need go hungry in Tunbridge Wells and the surrounding areas.

We are therefore reaching out to the friends and families of our Holmewood community to invite them to give their support in any way that they can.

Thank you.

Title: Chantal's Christmas

CharityName: The Food Bank (an initiative of Into the Community)
Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page. 

After yesterday's humbling experience, as detailed below, I know we can all make a difference to other people's lives by just taking five minutes out of our busy day and donating a small amount of money. I would love to raise £1000 pounds for the Food Bank in Worcester to help put a smile on numerous family faces this Christmas. Can you spare £5.00 and go without that bottle of wine, others can't even afford a loaf of bread to feed their children and we sit eating takeaways in front of the TV in our lovely warm homes. Please help me by SHARING this post and donate what you can.... The more we share, the more people we reach, the more we can raise and the more people we can make SMILE! Come on Facebookers lets do sometime productive and help the people who really need it!.

" I took my dogs for a walk last night and found myself walking and walking after over five miles I found myself at a local pub! The dogs were welcome in and I sat alone in the corner waiting for my husband to pick me up when I got talking to a stranger. One hour later it transpires that the guy was an ex- serviceman who due to PTS had found himself living locally in a tent, we got talking and although his life was tough he took nothing from the government but did odd jobs in order to provide for himself. I brought him a pint and later my son and husband turned up, he offered to buy us all a drink which I decided as we were driving, he still came back from the bar with three orange juices. We have so much and he has nothing but yet he still brought us a drink which he could not afford. We all have so much in life and yet others have nothing and yet they are willing to share what they have! My son learnt so much tonight, on the way home he asked if we could give all his old toys to other people for Christmas that didn't have things for Christmas! Tomorrow I am off to do a weeks shop and leave it with the landlord to give to that man as last night was a truly moving experience not just for me but for my entire family! A Ramon night but such a humbling evening... Please help me by donating to the local Food Bank, its amazing how much satisfaction you get from helping others rather than enriching our already saturated lives.

Please donate through:-

Description:
Over the coming weeks, we’d like for people to get involved and to do something creative. It can be art, knitting, a funny video, a poem about life in quarantine - just about anything creative! 

As you've submitted your 'work',  please upload to the charity auction folder on the planning Sharepoint site. 

People can then check out the collection and go to Just giving, donate money and write which item they are 'bidding' (donating) for. 

Hopefully we end up with a rich collection of inspiring and fun creations, it will also be interesting to see the diversity of talent across the department :). There is also no such thing as no talent. To quote Sophie Parker, 'Always be proud of your work!'

All the donations will go to Trussell Trust. The charity has over 1,200 food bank centres in the UK network which they use to provide emergency support to those in need of food during COVID-19 and beyond.

TC Lee13 & The Tank Club Present - The Trussell Trust Weekend Stream Fundraiser

Title: The Trussell Trust Weekend Fundraiser page

Description:
I've been growing my hair for a while now, in part due to laziness, in part to see what it looks like. Today I got sent home from work as my girlfriend has a cough, and this is where I must stay for the next two weeks. I fortunately have enough food in my house for this time, but perspective is important. Thousands are currently at risk as they don't have this privilege. It is for this reason that, from my isolation, I want to help and I encourage you to too. 

The longer one's hair becomes, the more daunting the idea is to cut it. At present my messy mop has taken numerous months of cultivation. I've defended it's appearance to my girlfriend, my colleagues and my family. Now it will go. The more I raise the shorter it will be cut. Now is the chance to see my whole head gleaming like a fortune teller's crystal ball.

Title: Catherine's Cryptic Pun Crossword

Description:
According to the United Nations, at least 3.2 million Yemenis have been displaced, and 14 million out of the 27 million population are estimated to be in need of food assistance.

The economy and infrastructure of what was already the poorest country in the Middle East is today in ruins. Worse still, a deadly famine has been sparked leaving thousands of children in several of Yemen’s provinces facing a slow death.

Ummah Welfare Trust has launched an emergency appeal for suffering families in Yemen, the land of faith and wisdom. Through local partners, the charity is delivering emergency assistance to displaced and hungry families in Sana’a, Aden, Taiz and Hudaydah.

Women and children in Yemen today are displaced and hungry. It is our duty to come to their aid and support them with that which Allah has granted us.

The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said:
‘The people of Yemen have the most tender of hearts and softest of souls; and they are the most obedient (in the worship of Allah).’
[Ahmad]
Title: Kalsuma's Yemen crisis appeal - Emergency food aid

Description:
Hunger in Afghanistan

Almost 40% of the population live in extreme poverty. The country has some of the world’s highest infant, child, and maternal mortality rates, and many thousands of children die needlessly each year because they lack access to good food and nutrition.

30% of Afghans lack food security and don’t know where their next meal is coming from. Living in such extreme conditions, Penny Appeal asks you to help. By simply donating £1 you will provide a meal to those who need it most.

Donate food to Afghanistan for just £1

With just £1, you can feed the hungry in Afghanistan. Your small change will provide food to those who would otherwise go without, and provide a desperately needy person with a nutritious meal.

For just £30, you can help the poor in Afghanistan by providing someone with one meal every single day for a month.

This Ramadan, Penny Appeal aim to distribute almost 25,000 meals to individuals and families crippled by poverty in Afghanistan.

Beyond providing daily meals, we will be distributing food hampers, organising community iftar and suhoor programmes, gifting essential household items and clothing and providing healthcare and medicine. We will work closely with families to support them to become financially independent.
Title: KCL ISOC 2020 Sisters: Feed Afghanistan

Description:
I have always said I would volunteer at a food bank because I feel so sad that I live in a world where they have to exist. However I have also always given myself the excuse that ‘I don’t have time to help’ so in light of current events and the families that must be struggling so much in this situation, I have decided to try and raise a few pennies.

If you can spare a few coins please do.
Title: Mark's Head Shave

Description:
Liliana has just recently learnt to ride her bike. With this current climate she wanted to do something to support families in need. She will be dressing up and riding her bike for 3 miles a day for 5 days. Please support her in making a little difference to a very good cause.

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Title: Tippler's Live Lounge

Description:
Due to the Coronavirus outbreak enquires to the food banks have gone up threefold and donations have plummeted. Last year food banks provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Just imagine that this year around 4 million food parcels  may be needed, at the point where food bank reserves are at their lowest. We need to help people with their absolute basics to get through this crisis. 

So as a light hearted incentive in troubling times I am asking you to guess Georgie’s breed makeup. Just look at those ears...who do they belong to? Does she really have donkey in her DNA or is this a red herring? We will find out exactly what she is in April......

Some clues:

She loves to snuggle up in bed

She is as fast as the speed of light.....

Cat’s however chase her

She can be a bit naughty and stubborn 

She loves all humans

She gets over excited, especially with ball games

Bees and flies ( and presumably wasps) are worth chasing



The person/s guessing the nearest combination will have a special prize. (To be decided) To enter please donate anything on this page and please leave your name.
Title: Julia's Guess The Breed Results are In

Description:
We are very shaken by the current pandemic that is afflicting the world. This is an unprecedented challenge, and we don’t yet know how things will unfold.

Supermarket shelves are empty. People are filling up their own trollies and cupboards to try to deal with the panic of an unknown pandemic - and food banks up and down the country are running out of food. Last year, food banks in Trussell Trust's network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can end the need for food banks.

We expect no one should be left hungry or destitute.

We have put together a series of live streams that will be broadcasted on our platforms on Fridays and on Saturdays, as a sign of hope, unity and positivity for those who want to spend 1 hour in our company and enjoy the music we love, analyse and discuss some fundemantal topics for us and share knowledge, culture and innovation around the world. Furthermore, we will act in compliance with the rules as this will ensure the safety of both, those who make the recordings and those who listen to them, in order to promote temporary social distancing.

Join us on facebook.com/ComaSoundLTD/ at 7PM (UK Time) every Friday and Saturday during this lockdown that has been imposed upon us.

All the money raised here goes directly to the Trussell Trust, who will use it to support people in need and at risk of food insecurity and hunger throughout the UK.

If you can't afford to donate - sharing it on social media and enjoying some quality music is free! Thank you for your support.

--------------

Coma was born on the 3rd of December 2010 as a platform for new and talented artists to develop and emerge alongside well known artists who hardly performed in the U.K. before and whom brought a new emphasis to the U.K.'s underground electronic music scene. comahq.com

The Trussell Trust, in conjunction with local communities, develops and runs sustainable projects in the UK tackling poverty and exclusion. Through the UK Foodbank Network and Community Enterprises we work with marginalised people in real need, providing practical care and support. trusselltrust.org

Title: Dan & George's Mount Kilimanjaro Climb.

Description:
The Trussel Trust support those most in need across the United Kingdom. No one in this country should go hungry and it is a sad state of affairs that reliance on food banks is growing daily. Over a six month period from April-September 2019, 823,145 three day emergency food parcels were given to people in crisis in the U.K over a third of these, (301,653) went to children. To put that in to perspective that's a 23% increase on the same period the following year.

Anything that you can give to help support the Trussel Trust and the national food bank will be greatly appreciated.

I had aimed to run three marathons and several shorter races during 2020, but most have obviously been cancelled or postponed because of Coronavirus. Instead I have changed the challenge to me running as many miles as I can during 2020. I will still undertake challenges to keep the motivation going. 

The biggest challenge was to run 100 miles in a week from the 25th-31st of May as part of a virtual running challenge which included a 55 mile lap of the Isle of Arran which I completed in roughly 9 hours 45 minutes on a very hot day! 

After a disappointing summer running wise due to injury (I couldn’t really run properly for 3-4 months) I am now back to roughly running 40 miles a week. So far this year I have completed 1733 miles in 250 hours of running with an elevation gain of 172,000ft.

I am aiming to run at least one more marathon before the end of the year..

 Make sure that those in need have food this Christmas time by supporting the national food bank.

Thanks for visiting my justgiving page.

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I'm going to be doing a 7 day water fast between 09/11/2016 - 16/11/2016. This involves not eating or drinking anything other than water for 7 days.

More than 13 million people live below the poverty line in the UK and this is as high as 10% of people in Scotland. The Trussell Trust helps to provide for these individuals and families through food banks.

The main reason for me doing this is to raise a lot of money for the charity and hopefully help a lot of people, but also to experience what it is like to go try and go about my normal life after not eating for a few days which is what some people have to do when providing for their families.

Title: Liams fast for food

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Poverty in this country is becoming a real issue. The use of food banks has increased by 97% in the  last year. It's heartbreaking to think that in the 21st century, there were families this Christmas that had no food and no presents for their children. Women have to rely on food banks for sanitary items, due to their vast expense. Issues with universal credit have left many families without any money over the Christmas period. The fallout from poverty is enormous; mental health issues, access to health services, travel, employment, access to healthy food, happy and well cared for children. 

Without foodbanks, many people in poverty would have NO access to food at all. They provide a safe space. Somewhere warm and dry. They can also offer support and advice to those in need, who may be isolated or unsure of their options. We have nurses in this country who have to use foodbanks, just to survive. I can't change the way this country is going (I wish I could), but if I can do something, even if it's only a small contribution, then I feel like I've helped in some way. Also, please donate food to local foodbanks whenever you can. You never know when you might have to rely on their services yourself. You can visit: 

https://www.trusselltrust.org/get-help/find-a-foodbank/?gclid=EAIaIQobChMI_43Akrex2AIVZLftCh0_TQCUEAAYASAAEgL6FvD_BwE and enter a postcode to find your local foodbanks. 

Donate by text by texting VAPE67 to 70070. For a £1 donation, text VAPE67 £1.  Minimum is £1 

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Title: Charity Dance Class

Description:
Unprecedented times call for unprecedented measures.  

I've always admired the Mohican, I think the office would have loved it.  I can imagine them bursting into smiles as I came in for the first time after having one.   

I'll be at home for the foreseeable future and willing to get this much desired haircut, groomed expertly by my household quarantine mate Giedre.  

All it takes to get this off the ground is for you, my friends and family, to donate £100 to instant neighbor to provide emergency food parcels to those in need along with nappies and essential babycare equipment to parents in need in Aberdeen area. 

If we got to £200, I'd dyed it yellow like the picture.  Let's see how it goes...  Monday the clippers come out!
Title: Gary Gary's Going Mohican

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

SANTA PUNCHES POVERTY;  donate 1.00

When somebody asks me....”are you excited about Christmas?”, my answer is ALWAYS a resounding YES!! It’s the season of goodwill, a time for friends and family, a happy time for all.....well almost all.

What if you don’t have any friends? What if you don’t have any money? What if you don’t have a home?

It is reported by local authorities that there are over 200,000 people registered as homeless here in the UK, more if you count those that “the system” misses; for more detailed information visit the following link:-

https://crisis.org.uk/media/236823/homelessness_monitor_england_2017.pdf

What will Christmas mean to this ridiculously high number of people?

The answer....the exact opposite to how you and I feel. Imagine how being cold and hungry throughout our winter months feels.......try it for a night, I guarantee you’ll not be doing it again.

Homelessness affects people of all ages, old, young, middle aged....a high percentage suffering with a Mental Health issue.

So if you’re willing, here’s what I suggest we do, either donate just 1.00 direct to the Trussell Trust to support their campaign “stopping UK hunger”.

A link to the Trussel Trusts website directory is below:-

https://www.trusselltrust.org/

OR.....

Imagine what a MASSIVE difference it would make to our country’s needy if every day throughout December we all put aside at least 1 tin or packet of food as a donation, and once a week delivered what we have collected to a local Food-Bank?

The Trussell Trust, a fantastic charity trying to “stop UK hunger”, have a searchable directory of Food-Banks listed on their website that rely almost entirely on the general public for food and drink donations. I guarantee that every single one of these Food-Banks will be inundated with requests for food and drink from Britain's Homeless over the coming festive season.

If you’re up for the challenge, register here, visit the Trussell Trusts website to locate your nearest Food-Bank, and let’s start giving.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/santa-punches-poverty-tickets-39698608607

One last thing to ask, let’s flood Social Media with the tag #santapunchespoverty and show our support for the UK‘s homeless society, showing the powers that be that homelessness is simply not acceptable in this day and age.

Thank you for reading, and let’s give generously!

Please feel free to post photographs of you and your family and friends "giving" on yours and my Twitter page.

Dave

@secbus

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Please donate to this wonderful charity that provides food for families locally who are in desperate need, no-one should be in this situation so please help provide enough for them, thanks
Title: HELEN's Dry January

Description:
1 in 5 people live below the poverty line.  

Me and Elise want to raise as much money as we can so  we can deliver much needed items to local foodbanks over the Christmas period. 

Making a choice between food and  presents for my children this Christmas is not a decision I will have  to make and we hope anyone reading this is also fortunate enough. 

Christmas should be full of magic and joy as well as giving so please  donate what ever you can  x x
Title: Help Families over Christmas

Description:
Action Hands is a community campaign launched during COVID19 by London Nursery Schools (LNS) founder Sara Brennan, Amanda Frolich and Alison Wheeler to support the well being of young children and families through music and play. 

With this song "Time To Shine", The Action Hands team is raising funds for the Trussell Trust to provide food for families in need during COVID19. 

Last year, Trussell Trust food banks provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. The Trussell Trust aims to end the need for food banks. As a nation, The Trussell Trust believes no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Thank you for watching our video Time To Shine.  

https://youtu.be/LcEJ-2WptvM

It is a cause very close to our hearts and we hope you can show your support for this worthy cause.  The song will be available soon to purchase and download on all the regular digital platforms.  All profits from the downloads will also go to The Trussell Trust.  

Keep safe everyone!

With love

Action Hands   

(Sara/Amanda/Alison)
Title: Action Hands -  Time To Shine

Description:
We’re both suckers for junk food and have decided to get healthier for a great cause!

From 1st May until 1st December 2020 we are giving up chocolate, biscuits, sweets and crisps! We don’t do anything by halves! 

Last year, Trussell Trust food banks provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics and during the Covid 19 crisis, food banks are under even more pressure.

With your help, we can replenish some of the extra food that has been needed during this time as the Trussell Trust works towards ending the need for food banks all together. 

No one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Helen and Rosies Junk Food Detox!

Description:
We're going to be carrying out a 2.6 tri-challenge.

Bridget and William are a doing 26 minute tri-challenge - 8m40 running through a sprinkler, 8m40 biking round the garden and 8m40 running round the garden.

Alastair is doing 26 pull ups, 26 pushups and running 2.6 miles

I'm running 26 x round the garden, 26 x up the stairs and finishing with 26 pushups.

Rhona is baking 26 cookies, which we'll need at the end!

We're hoping to raise £26 each for the Trussell Trust:

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Title: The Mitchell's 2.6 Challenge

Description:
After a mixture of wanting to take part in the charitable challenges, and also wanting to do something to help those less fortunate in these lockdown days days... I decided to set a challenge to some friends. There are several great efforts going on to raise money for the NHS charities, so I thought i’d go with something that is local to many of my friends and colleagues - this is the area right next to Dell Glasgow (remember that place!?)

Challenge is simple (but not easy!) & for the golfers out there, but anyone can try it!

Just like several similar challenges, the golfer needs to get 20 balls, place a bucket, basin or plant pot etc. 10 feet away. Film yourself hitting all 20 and for everyone you get in the bucket - donate (a minimum) of £2.00 to the just giving page below.

https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/carlo-cocozza

The idea is to get a lot of people taking part, so please post your video and nominate another garden golfer!

If you are tagged in this, you are nominated 😉 good luck!

Eg get 1 out of 20, donate £2 (or whatever you choose).
Get none in, donate at least £2 anyway. Every ‘ball in the bucket’ could be a meal for someone.

———

I'm going to be taking on the Everesting challenge on Zwift. It's simple - climb 8,848m or the equivalent of Everest in one ride. You are only allowed to use one climb, which you have to ride up and down repeatedly to make the height gain.

 Alpe du Zwift is 516m at its peak. I'm expecting to have to ride the segment 16 or 17 times, equating to about 200km in the saddle. Zwift allows you to freewheel downhill, so loo breaks can be taken while "descending". Other than that, it's going to be hard work and the threat of a pretty numb bum.
Title: Dan is Everesting Alpe Du Zwift!

Description:
Food banks across the UK are being forced to close as the Covid 19 pandemic leads to a decline in volunteers and a shortage in food donations. The Trussell Trust supports a nationwide network of food banks with emergency food and campaign for change to end the need for food banks in the UK.

My local food bank Leeds North West serves 9 distribution centres across Leeds with emergency food supplies.

To reach my goal of running a half marathon on 15th June, I will need to double my current running distance of 10k to reach 21k (13 miles). Please give generously!
Title: Sarah's half-marathon

Description:
Islamic Help provides food security for tens of thousands of families in need across the world during Ramadan and throughout the year.

Already struggling to survive, their needs are accentuated during this blessed month when they might not have even basic foodstuffs for suhoor and iftar. Your support means the poorest and most vulnerable can share in the blessings of this precious month by having sufficient nutrition and by not having to worry about opening or closing their daily fast with. Not only during Ramadan but after as well Islamic Help will continue to provide food to those in need.


"Those who in charity spend of their goods by night and by day, in secret and in public, have their reward with their Lord: on them shall be no fear, nor shall they grieve"  Qur’an 2:274

  • £35 - Donate a food pack to those in need in Bangladesh, Rohingya, Cameroon or Central African Republic.
  • £50 - Donate a food pack to those in need in Pakistan, Tanzania, or for Palestinian/Syrian refugees in Jordan.
  • £70 - Donate a food pack to those in need in Yemen or Gaza

Please look deep in your heart and donate!
Title: Hasina's Ramadan Food Pack Appeal

Description:
In this period of Coronavirus lockdown there is increased pressure on the food banks for a variety of reasons:-

  • Unexpected job losses and increase in demand for supplies.
  • Regular donators being on lockdown.
  • Supermarket restrictions on purchasing multiple items.
  • Closure of many community buildings which act as drop off points for donations.

There is an amazing team of people working in the Bromley warehouse and in the centres, but they can only work with what has been donated.

Last year, food banks in their network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, they can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

I am hoping that I can help to raise funds to help them to keep supporting those that need them in the community.

I will buzz cut my hair to No. 6 all over if my full target is met. If I don't meet the target I should still like to keep your donations and would be happy to sport a suitable haircut commensurate with the amount raised - the more money, the more extreme. If I smash my target it could be a No 5 or shorter!!!

Please help.
Title: Miss Denton's 'Head Shave' Challenge

Description:
I am going to ride the distance of Lands End to John O'Groats (officially 876 miles, 1407kms) on an indoor bike starting on Saturday 11th April and will look to finish within the a week. I am raising money for the Trussell Trust who look after the UK food banks and at the moment families are in dire need of support. I hope you can donate as much as possible. 

You can join me on my ride on Zwift by following me. Just search for John McAvoy.

You can also donate via your mobile phone as follows:

Text JONNYMAC to 70450 to donate £5 - Texts cost £5 plus one standard rate message.

Or alternatively text:

“To donate £2 text JONNYMAC2 to 70450”

“To donate £10 text JONNYMAC10 to 70450”

“To donate £20 text JONNYMAC20 to 70450”
Title: John 's Zwifting from Lands End to John O'Groats

Description:
August 2021 update: I’ll be riding a 5-day bike tour around southern England, starting with a loop around the North Downs, then riding from Guildford to Salisbury, the New Forest, Portsmouth, round the Isle of Wight and back to Guildford. After such generous sponsorship last year, I’m not pushing for it this time but there remains great need for the Trussell Trust food banks, even more so now with supermarket shortages and Brexit price rises. So if you’ve made it here, please consider a kind donation while I ride with a strapped-up hamstring!

______________________________________________________

To mark turning 50, I’ve been planning to cycle the story of my life, from where I was born, Guisborough in the North Riding of Yorkshire, via all the places in this country I’ve lived in – taking in Kirby, Oxford, Reading, Guildford, Reigate and London – to end in Cambridge.

It was just going to be a personal challenge to mark a significant milestone. However, having spent my 50th birthday in the pandemic lockdown, I wanted to turn the bike tour into a chance to raise money for the Trussell Trust, whose food banks so many people rely on and which sadly is in even greater demand now as the severe economic hardship for many during this crisis intensifies.

I will be setting off on Sunday 19th July. I’ll provide updates throughout the bike tour on my dedicated Twitter account: https://twitter.com/phil50biketour

Thank you for anything you are able to give to help the Trussell Trust help those who most need it.

Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trust network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, the Trussell Trust can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Phil 50 bike tour (the story of my life)

Description:
Cyril, aged 6, decided to shave his head for the 'Trussell Trust' which is a vital food bank for people who are struggling financially. So many more people are struggling in these hard times.

I thought I'd keep him company and shave my head...again! 

Last time I did this was 2015 when my oldest, Olive, was nearly 3 and Cyril was 18 months. My youngest, Maud, is now 2 and a half. I raised £5000 for Cancer Research, as a joint effort with a friend, and donated my hair to 'The Little Princess Trust' who make wigs for children that have lost their hair due to cancer treatments.

I hope to donate to The Little Princess Trust again when they are up and running again. Blonde hair this time!

I am not expecting to raise anything near £5000 this time due to the current financial worries a lot of people will be faced with.

If all this does is save me from the worst root regrowth then so be it! 

Some people said bald suited me last time- it didn't and certainly doesn't this time as I am fatter, paler and older!

We are asking for anyone who can spare anything at all to donate to this worthy cause please and/or 'Share' as much as you can on any social media! 

Thank you,

Cyril and Claire. xxx
Title: Cyril and Mummy's head shave

Description: I will be taking part in Celtic FC Foundation's Zip Slide in Paradise event on Monday, April 13. I will be sliding diagonally from East to West, leaving from the very top corner of the North Stand seating deck, at the Lisbon Lions Stand side, and gliding all the way across to the lower corner of the Jock Stein at the Main Stand side. I have been tasked with raising a minimum of £130 in support of Celtic FC Foundation.
Title: Zip Slide in Paradise 2020

Description:
In this time of unprecedented crisis, many have lost their livelihoods and income meaning food security has become an even greater concern within our community and food banks are vital. 

In an effort to fundraise for The Trussell Trust food bank network I will be shaving my head and donating my hair to the Little Princess Trust who provide free, real hair wigs to children with hair loss and fund crucial research into childhood cancers. 

Unfortunately, given the current situation, the Little Princess Trust are understandably unable to receive hair donations and I won’t be able to shave my head until they can. 

However, considering the recent enforcements made to prevent virus spread, food aid is needed urgently and any donations, no matter the size, will be greatly appreciated by myself, The Trussell Trust and any person relying on food banks to stay safe and fed in this trying time. Even £2 can make a difference x

The Trussell Trust story:

 Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Description:
In these unprecedented times, food banks will be more important than ever. Children that would have relied on free school meals may not receive them, thousands will lose jobs, and food poverty will undoubtedly rise. I've had my beloved beard for over five years and I've forgotten what my own face looks like. If I raise £200, I'll shave it off (and my girlfriend has agreed she can't leave me).

Trussell Trust's story:

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Description: Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page. I’m not running a marathon or doing anything heroic like that, I just want to try to raise a bit of money to support The Trussell Trust, the UK’s main food bank charity, because I believe coronavirus panic buying at supermarkets by people who can financially afford to panic buy is wiping supermarket shelves clean of even the absolute basic essentials that people less fortunate than many of us can barely afford anyway. If you yourself have a few quid to spare, please help. What’s £10? A packet of fags or a takeaway pizza. Please help stop the Coronavirus Poverty Gap.
Title: Jonathan's Stop The Coronavirus Poverty Gap

Description: I'm taking on Himmah's Food Bank Parcel Challenge this December.To raise sponsorship to help feed local vulnerable people in urgent need of food and basic toiletries? We have seen a huge increase in demand for our Food Bank & hotmeals services in recent years due to rising poverty levels across the UK. In the part of Nottingham where Himmah is based, a shocking 1 in 3 of children now live in poverty. Donate and let's tackle food poverty!

Description:
During quarantine, I have found a love for beading and braiding. When my parents explained what they were doing to help out during the current crisis, I decided that I wanted to help out too. I have dedicated my free time to making bracelets, necklaces and anklets, shown on my Instagram page @beadsbybailey. Each beaded bracelet/anklet is £6, all necklaces £10 and the braided bracelets are £2. All proceeds go straight to Food For All. I hope that you support my cause and enjoy the beauty of my creations, knowing that every penny is being donated. Please contact us at info@beadsbybailey.com to place an order.

XOXO Bailey

Please use this page to make your donation to Food For All. Simply click on the "DONATE NOW" button and submit your kind donation along with your delivery address. Once Beads By Bailey receives confirmation, your order will be dispatched. Thank you.

 *disclaimer bracelets are being hand made and sent by Beads By Bailey, independent of Food For All, abiding by Covid-19 Health & Safety Rules.

Food For All is an entirely volunteer run and managed food relief charity based in central London which currently provides 5,000 free meals a day to community groups and local authorities, as well as on the streets for people without accommodation.

Food For All are continuing to offer their usual free hot meal service for people in need during Covid-19 and have, in fact, expanded their service in this difficult time.

Description: Galvanised by the belief that being clean is not a luxury or a privilege, The Hygiene Bank is a registered, people powered, grassroots charity grounded in community. We collect and re-distribute donated toiletries, hygiene, beauty and personal care items to UK charities, voluntary organisations and schools. These in turn are then given for free to their beneficiaries. Our passion stems from a sense of injustice: it's not right that anyone should face hygiene poverty in modern Britain.

Description:
Starting on Saturday 25th April, I’ll be running a marathon over 10 days averaging 2.62miles a day. To add a bit of humour, I will be RUNNING IN MY WEDDING DRESS! 😂 I’ll be doing this event to raise money for The Trussell Trust, who are working tirelessly to end hunger and poverty in UK. As a result of COVID they need our help more than ever right now. There are over 14 million people in the UK living in poverty, and 4.5 million are children.

We all need a bit of cheering up right now, and I thought the added comedy of running in my wedding dress would help put a smile on people's faces as I run past their homes. (I’ll obviously be strictly sticking to social distancing rules.)

Any donation to help this much needed cause would be hugely appreciated.
Title: Zehra's running a marathon (over 10 days) in her wedding dress

Description:
There are an estimated 153 million orphans worldwide, with around 5,700 more children becoming orphans, everyday. As the most vulnerable members of society, They often face hunger, disease, exploitation and extreme cycles of poverty they will never break out of. Orphans desperately need our help.



‘The Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) said, “I and the one who sponsors an orphan will be in paradise like these two! - and he gestured with his forefinger and middle finger, holding them close together.’

Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page. In these last few days leading up to the end of Ramadan we're trying to raise 1k for WATAN UK and every little helps. Thanks inadvance for any donation you make. 

The humanitarian crisis in Idlib has worsened as the recent escalation of hostilities displaced over 586,000 civilians, following continuous shelling & airstrikes.

Provide emergency aid for the affected civilians. Watan UK is delivering essential items directly to the Syrian refugees.

With your help, we will be able to provide care packs for some of the most vulnerable Syrian families in Idlib, who have no shelter or food and water or sanitation.

What can your donation provide?

£60 could provide food and water packs to families 🍞

_£255 could deliver emergency shelter and food pack for a family with conveniences.

£850 could provide a full shelter for a family for a year- semi permanent shelter with conveniences.

The Prophet, peace be upon him, said: “The believer’s shade on the Day of Resurrection will be his charity.” (Al-Tirmidhi)

Assalamu'alaykum,

earn the same reward as him, without anything being lessened from the reward of the fasting person”.

Ramadan is the month of blessings and giving. Every Muslim deserves to spend the month of Ramadan without having to worry about the food for Suhoor and Iftar. For this reason, I’m raising money for the families in need and any donation will help make a difference.

If you see every individual's world, as the entire world, you will come to realise, every single person you help, is a world that has been changed. 

"There is no barrier between it [the Du'a of the oppressed person] and Allah". - Prophet Muhammad SAW

Please donate what you can and receive the Du'a of some of the most oppressed people on the planet.

Jazakallah Khair.

Title: Rogue are singing for their supper

Description:
The Trussell Trust has warned that more people are likely to need a food bank's support as a result of the coronavirus outbreak.

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Fundraising 2020

Description:
While we're all stuck at home, I wanted to do something to put a smile on your face, and raise some money for the Trussell Trust. The national charity's network of food banks are expecting to see an increase in need over the coming weeks as the coronavirus pandemic unfolds.

To help, and hopefully(!) brighten up your day, I am dedicating my mornings to video call as many of you who donate as possible. All you need to do is donate to the Trussell Trust on this page, ensure your phone number is included in your donation, and tick that you are happy to receive further communications so that I am allowed to call you!

By donating, not only will you be in for the chance of a receiving a video call from me, but you will also help people struggling as a result of the coronavirus pandemic. 

Food banks were already seeing an increased need before this outbreak but it's likely that more people than ever will be unable to afford their own food over the coming weeks, especially people who have unstable jobs or who aren't eligible for sick pay, and will need to turn to a food bank for support. 

Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trust’s network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over half a million of these of these going to children. 

Your donations will help the Trussell Trust support food banks in their network and ensure people in crisis can access emergency food during this challenging time. This money could help fund vans to help food banks deliver food to people's homes, buy food (if necessary and available!), recruit additional staff to meet the demand, but also, vitally, campaign for change so that everyone can afford their own food. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and I look forward to chatting to a few of you over the coming days.

NOW FOR THE LEGAL PART: 

All funds raised will go directly to the Trussell Trust. You can find out more about the organisation on their website www.trusselltrust.org. 

I will try to call as many of you as possible but it might not be possible to speak to everyone who donates. 

Please note that I can only contact you if you provide a phone number and ‘opt in’ to share their details with the Trussell Trust. 

The Trussell Trust is committed to protecting your privacy and will process any personal data in accordance with the General Data Protection Act 2018. Your details will be kept safe and secure, only used by the Trussell Trust or those who work for us and will not be shared, sold or rented to third parties for marketing purposes. In this instance, your details (first name, phone number and amount donated), will be shared with Michael McIntyre for the purposes of this fundraising event only.

We may use information you provide for analysis, research or screening purposes in order to help us understand our supporters so that we can save resources and deliver the best possible service.
Title: Michael McIntyre is supporting the Trussell Trust

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Description:
Alhamdulillah we've reached our target of £5,000! That’s £20,000 in total now including our Feed the Fasting campaign. Thank you all for your kind donations, may Allah reward you!

We have now moved onto a new project, to build a Mosque with Muslim Hands. You will also receive the Ramadan e-Cookbook if you donate through this project.

The link for this is:
https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/halalfooddiary2020-mosque

Title: Halal Food Diary's Orphan Sponsorship Appeal

Description:
At Birmingham Childrens Hospital Charity, we believe theres always more we can do for our sick kids and thats why we will always strive to do more for our patients and families. Its our mission to raise the vital funds needed to make a real difference to all who use our hospital.

On Friday 8th May Zane woke up and told his Mom and myself he was going to run a marathon. Now, not one to ever tell him he can't achieve anything he sets his mind to, I am aware it's a fairly big ask for a 10 year old in lockdown. Anyone who knows Zane will understand he's not afraid of a challenge. We managed to convince him to attempt this feat over the bank holiday weekend. So, Zane will be running 26 miles broken down in segments. He will average circa 9 miles per day which is quite an effort for his age, well any age. We decided to wait until he started and understood the enormity of what he was attempting. He now knows but is still committed 😀 Completely of his own undertaking, he also said be wanted to raise money for the same charity that was the one people supported to remember Tom. If you can help Zane, even a pound would mean the world to him. Thank you for reading. Zane Skinner 10 years 3 months and slightly bonkers.
Title: Zane's Bank Holiday Marathon

Description:
Help me raise urgently needed funds to provide families in need around the world with food for the blessed month of Ramadan. Millions of people will be waiting on us to provide them with Iftar and Suhoor for Ramadan, we need your help to get it to as many as we can. I want to Raise money for 100 Family Food Packs and 1 Water Filtration Plant for a School.

For many of the countries, the Food Packs start from as little as £25 or you can help provide cooked Iftar meals from only £2 per person. Please donate any amount that you can afford, whether you want to feed one family or more or if you want to feed one person or more, every penny donated will contribute to our relief efforts.

Also, if you would like to donate towards a Water Pump as Sadiqah Jaria in the name of our Beloved Prophet (pbuh) or a loved one, then you can also donate through this link by adjusting the amount you would like to donate. Please let me know who's name you would like to be written with the pump. A hand water

John would have wanted me to do this.

Title: Tulsa Alumni Virtual 5k page

Description:
Please join me on the Boxing Day 2019 from Midday for my charity stream to help raise as much money as we can for such an amazing cause.

You can find me at www.twitch.tv/nelinde

If you can't make a donation fear not! You can help by spreading the word and sharing this JustGiving page on social media and with friends and family.


No one should go hungry, especially at Xmas! 

Yet thousands of families are going without food due to poverty, parents going without so their children don't have empty bellies.

This is 2019! This shouldn't even be a thing... Sadly so many people in the UK are in this dire situation. It could be a neighbour or even a family member!

UK Food Banks are vastly overstretched and are in need of food donations more than ever before to meet the highest demands ever to be recorded since the Trussell Trust started in 1999!


But you can help spread a little Xmas cheer <3 


Please spare what you can afford, as little as £2 can afford a single meal!

You can also help by donating any spare "long shelf life" foods such as tinned vegetables etc to your local Food Bank or supermarket Food Bank collection box <3

Having personally relied on my local Food Bank in previous times of hardship I have first hand experience of the effect and contribution Food Banks have on so many people facing financial hardship and not being able to afford food for their families or themselves. They provide a light in times of darkness, often providing much more than just food. 

They offer an ear to listen, a personal connection where there is nothing but loneliness. Many Food Banks even provide clothing that they've had donated. My local Food Bank even run a free playgroup where parents can go to meet other parents and make friendships.

I can't stress how much a small donation can help <3






Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

Description: The Trussell Trust support a nationwide network of food banks and provide emergency food and support to people locked in poverty, and campaign for change to end the need for food banks in the UK.
Title: The Trussell Trust

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.

As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Abbys lockdown challenge

Description:
I set this page up for last year's marathon but it was then cancelled and this year's one moved to October. 

Before Christmas 2020 I read a lot about food banks in the UK and found it quite shocking. Not a lot has changed now and so I want to try to raise some more money. There are more people using them than ever in many parts of the country, and the Trussell Trust support a nationwide network of over 1200 food banks. They provide emergency food and support to people locked in poverty, and campaign for change to end the need for food banks in the UK.

Between April 2019 and March 2020, food banks in the Trussell Trust network provided a record 1.9 million food supplies to people in crisis, an 18% increase on the previous year and during the coronavirus pandemic food banks have seen need rise even further.

I know I have run the marathon before, and I know I have asked for donations before. But this seems like a really worthy cause and an issue that worries me a lot so I hope people will find a few spare quid to donate. I will definitely top up the final total myself too as I feel in a very fortunate to be running the London Marathon and want to complete the race knowing it has also done some good. 

If you are a UK taxpayers and want to sponsor me please tick the Gift Aid box. This enables them to claim an extra 25p per £1 you donate at no extra cost to you. A £10 donation will be transformed into £12.50 and makes a huge difference so please do so. 

Many thanks 

Jeffers

Description:

Yemen now officially hosts the worlds largest human-induced food security crisis.

With the ongoing conflict in Yemen  already one of the poorest countries in the region  tens of thousands of lives have been lost and over 20 million people dont know where their next meal will come from. A country crippled by conflict is sadly now on the brink of famine.

Islamic Relief is on the ground in 19 of the countrys 22 governorates, providing essential food aid to families at risk of famine and facing extensive food insecurity.
 
With your support we can help these communities in their hour of need. For men, women and children across the country, finding their next meal is a growing challenge.

I am taking on the Ready, Steady, Iftar challenge to provide food for families in Yemen this Ramadan.

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page. FBB have welcomed me into their family since Freddie died and have given me such positivity in terrible circumstances. 

Since the start of the Coronavirus outbreak, FBB have been working tirelessly to support our participants. We are increasingly learning from schools that they are struggling to reach out to their most vulnerable students, but our Virtual School has shown that it doesn't have to be this way. We have designed a digital curriculum based around young people's needs and passions, and have been able to reach more than half of our programme participants. This is in stark contrast to the national picture, where it is estimated just 5% of vulnerable children have been engaging with their school work. Please support us however you can to help us continue to improve and develop our programmes and reach even more young people.

Here's some of the ways you can get involved and be part of the FBB fam! 

1. Run, walk or cycle and tell us how far you've travelled!                                Email mirandaporritt@yahoo.co.uk 

2. Run, walk or cycle and donate what you can to FBB, we hope to raise at least £1 for every mile completed. 

3. If you love what we do and feel you wish to support FBB further, please visit our website and choose to become a monthly supporter: https://www.footballbeyondborders.org/donate/

Description:
The Aim and Purpose of our Team is to ensure that vital Help, Support and Aid reaches those less fortunate people all around the world Insha'Allah, who heavily rely on the Kindness and Generosity of many of you reading this Appeal Post.

Our Team, Amir-e-Millat Trust Foundation (AKSA) have recently made 2 visits to Pakistan. Our first charity trip was in Ramadan - May 2019, where we supported a number of families across Pakistan and Kashmir by providing vital support in terms of Food Packages, Clothing and Financial Aid. We have very recently made another visit to Pakistan, Azad Kashmir, in October 2019, to provide aid and deliver your charity to the victims of the October Earthquake which left many families homeless and without any financial support.

Alhamdulillah we have ventured on our 3rd Fundraiser and we are currently providing Food Packages with Essentials amounting to 50KG worth of items which will support a family for an entire month during Ramadan Insha'Allah.

2kg date
surf
soap

Tea bags
3kg salt
Roo afza
5kg sugar
5kg ghee
5kh rice
Gram flour
3kg of each 4 dhaals
Variety of spices
Semiya (vermicelli)

The Prophet, upon be peace, said: “The believer’s shade on the Day of Resurrection will be his charity.” (Al-Tirmidhi)

“Do not show lethargy or negligence in giving alms and charity till your last breath.” -prophet  Muhammad, peace be upon him (Bukhari and Muslim).


Please do not hesitate to contact any of our team if you have any questions or require any help with understanding our mission.

Title: Helping The People Of Yemen

Description:
Assalamualaykum Everyone,

If you are here, consider yourself blessed to have the opportunity to be part of an extremely rewarding chance to make a difference to orphan children's lives this Ramadan, Alhamdulillah!  

This Ramadan, my family, friends and I are raising money for orphan children. With no parents to guide them, orphan children are usually the most deprived and vulnerable group in any society. Everyday thousands of orphan children trek for hours to get to a school - just so they can get an education and thus, escape poverty. 

Each orphan can be sponsored for £360 per year. This gives them the funds to be looked after and educated completely for an entire year ! It will change their lives forever.

I am looking to sponsor 10 orphan children this Ramadan. InShaaAllah.

The READ Foundation is a UK registered charity which helps look after over 11,000 orphan children in its 390 schools. Read Foundation's work is phenomenal as they help transform lives of needy children, through education. 

Even if you can only afford to donate £1 then please do so, as no charity given is too small.

Allah (swt) says in the Qur'an - ‘They ask you, [O Muhammad], what they should spend [in charity]. Say, “Whatever you spend of good is [to be] for parents and relatives and orphans and the needy and the traveller. And whatever you do of good - indeed, Allah is Knowing of it.”’ (Al Baqarah: 215). This verse tells us that orphans actually have the right to be taken care of. But with every right comes responsibility, and the Qur'an places this responsibility on the individual, meaning everyone should give to orphans in need.

You can learn more about the Read Foundation in this video:-

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9EJibNhGzeE&t=9s

Your Zakat, Sadaqa, and lillah could change the lives of orphans.

Please Donate generously now and secure your aakhirah this Ramadan! 

Click on Donate on the side.

A child dies from drinking dirty water every 20 seconds, that's 4,000 children every day whose deaths could have been prevented with access to clean water.

By providing clean and safe water for drinking and domestic use, you are transforming communities, empowering them to achieve better health, social and economic well-being.

Title: sergant_stumpy's Flicka Donkey Foundation appeal.

Description:
Tabitha’s Personal story;

In January 2020, I was admitted into hospital for a routine induction for the birth of my first son Logan. I was fighting Pneumonia at the time, but I had no hiccups besides that. Once it came to being in active labour, I had a routine episiotomy due to some difficulty and my son was born at 3:43am January 31st 2020. However, things went downhill really quickly. Myself and Logan were put on IV antibiotics very quickly plus I had to have 2 blood transfusions (both failed) and I don’t really remember much from there. All I know is that the doctors told me they didn’t have much hope for me surviving and they were surprised I did. Logan and I were treated for sepsis for 7 days and we both came out of the situation okay thankfully. The mental effects of it were what made the suffering more horrendous and now, 15 weeks later, I want to be able to help others who have been through what I have. 

That’s why we are raising money for the U.K. sepsis trust and doing a charity bake sale.

Description:
In Catford and Lewisham we have the impact that Coronavirus Virus is having on the residents.  Many have self employed,  those on zero hours contracts and in low paid jobs have had the rug pulled from under them. Additionally,  many who have come to the UK for a safer and better life are finding things particularly hard. 

We at Catford Corps of The Salvation Army are seeking to ensure these people get a helping hand. Our volunteers are working hard to provide basic food parcels and other practical support to make life a bit easier in these hard times.  We know we can't feed everyone,  however, everyone food parcel we provide is a person or family helped.

Donations given go directly to helping us provide food and other practical assistance to someone in need in the Lewisham Borough.

Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

The humanitarian crisis in Idlib has worsened as the recent escalation of hostilities displaced over 586,000 civilians, following continuous shelling & airstrikes.

Provide emergency aid for the affected civilians. Watan UK is delivering essential items directly to the displaced Syrians in Idlib and the Syrian refugees.

With your help, we will be able to provide care packs for some of the most vulnerable Syrian families in Idlib, who have no shelter or food and water or sanitation.

What can your donation provide?
_£60 could provide food and water packs to families_ 

_£100 could provide food water and hygiene kits

_£255 could deliver emergency shelter and food pack for a family with conveniences.

£850 could provide a full shelter for a family for a year- semi permanent shelter with conveniences.

Thank you for your support and please do share with your contacts. 

 Together we can make a difference!
Title: Bayan's 10k in 10 Days of Ramadan Challenge

Description:
I’m raising funds for SKT Welfare because I really care about the great work they’re doing to alleviate
poverty and suffering around the globe.

SKT work with marginalised and vulnerable communities including with orphans and widows to help them build better futures. With their 100% donation policy, you can rest assured that every penny of your donation will go directly to those who need it most.


SKT Welfare is a UK registered charity and international NGO established in 2008, dedicated to the delivery of humanitarian aid and socioeconomic solutions regardless of race, political affiliation, gender or belief. The organisation’s aim is to help relieve the suffering of the world’s poor and disenfranchised communities.

SKT’s 100% donation policy means that every penny you donate is used for serving those in need, not administrative nor overhead costs, which are either covered by direct donations themselves or by using
Gift Aid.
Title: NAZIA'S  FUNDRAISER FOR FOOD PACKAGES FOR PAKISTAN

Description:
Right now, theres a global food shortage due to supplies being disrupted by Coronavirus. Families living in poverty in places like Gaza, Somalia and Syria dont have the luxury of stockpiling food.

This is why I've joined forces with Islamic Relief to help keep vulnerable people around the people safe during the blessed month of Ramadan by fundraising to provide a food pack for a family. 

Food packs are tailored to local cuisines and diets, but they contain items such as rice, lentils, oil, sugar, flour, tomato paste and dates.

Alhamdulillah Islamic Relief works in 30+ countries around the world providing life-saving food packs for families in need. Last year they managed to support over 900,000 people around the world!

The Prophet (SAW) said: Give charity without delay, for it stands in the way of calamity. (Tirmidhi)

Please help me feed just ONE family this Ramadan!
Title: Zainab's Ramadan Food Pack Challenge

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page - we are fundraising for KIND - Kids in Need and Distress - www.kind.org.uk.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

We are challenging ourselves to virtually walk from Liverpool to Lands End . . . . . and back again!

That is 14 days of covering 107,000 steps between us – there are 16 of us so ideally around 6,500 steps each day for each of us

Support is very much appreciated and needed for KIND.  All monies raised from our walk will be used to help fund our Crisis Food Project.  The Project started on Friday the 10th April and is due to continue until the end of June.  

Each week KIND are sourcing, packing and delivering between 150-200 family sized food packs and up to 30 individual packs.  Each pack contains fresh fruit and vegetables, bread, eggs and another 40 plus items.  

The packs are distributed via a network of referrers to disadvantaged/vulnerable families and adults across our community.  As well as providing much needed practical support it is also showing those families and adults that they are not alone during this crisis, that others in the community do care about them and their problems.  

100% of any donation will be spent on providing food and other essentials for these families and individuals.  

As a small Charity any support will be vital in helping to continue providing these resources until the end of June.
Title: Redwigwam Walks

Description:
The Flat Iron Fundraisers' Club

From now until the end of the month I am going to be cycling with Amy a total of 222 miles which is the distance from my home to Flat Iron's herd in Yorkshire. In addition to cycling I will also be giving up crisps for the entire month of May - for those of you that know me well know that this will be the hardest part of the challenge.

If you can donate £20 or more you can join the Flat Iron Fundraisers' Club with us. We will invite you in for a steak on us when our restaurants re-open.

The Felix Project & Flat Iron

The mission of the Felix Project is simple - to take surplus food from their suppliers and deliver it to any charity that helps feed people. It's all nutritious and would otherwise go to waste. Not only that, but it helps fight food poverty and reduces costs for hardworking organisations.

Over the past few weeks the Felix Project have tripled the amount of food they send out across London. Their food is helping people who have lost their jobs, people on low incomes, children and families who are struggling, people who are sick, key workers struggling to find food, older people who are isolated, people who are homeless, survivors of domestic abuse and refugees.

At Flat Iron we have been supporting The Felix Project for a while and we are thrilled to continue to help them through our Fundraisers Club even though our restaurants are temporarily shut.
Title: Cycling the distance to our Flat Iron herd

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

As COVID-19 ravages through communities around the world, it is easy to only think about the people on our doorstep. You could be forgiven for thinking this is only a first world problem, with people fighting over toilet paper, hand sanitizer and self-isolating at home on the sofa while watching TV.

This is a plague that has the world in its grip, and it is much more devastating for vulnerable communities in some of the poorer parts of the world; areas where READ Foundation operates.

I am hugely concerned about the welfare of the most vulnerable:  Orphans, widows, pupils and teachers need our help to survive. 

There are over 11,000 orphan children in READ Foundation 390 schools, who are struggling and in desperate need of help. There is no food, income or hygiene essentials.

A food pack and hygiene pack containing enough staple foods for a month will help them get though the month of Ramadan. 

Your Sadaqah or Zakat donation could be the intercession to save their lives.

May Allah accept our donations. Ameen

Title: Madina's 26 hour Live Charity Challenge

Description:
Ramadhan is upon us, and every day during our fasts, we are looking forward to the various dishes being prepared at home for iftar. For our brothers and sisters who have fled conflict throughout the last 10 years of their lives, the situation is quite different. For them even a loaf of bread to break their fast with is deemed luxury and they go many days not being able to break there fast at all. 

Our Syrian brothers and sisters once lived ordinary lives like all of us. Due to ongoing conflict in the region for the past 9 years, they have been displaced all around the world, surviving without adequate living conditions. 

 

I will be going to these camps later this year to help. My aim is to raise £4000 so that I can go myself and give out essential aid to these refugees in the form of food packs, fuel, medical equipment and shelter.

 It was narrated that the Prophet ﷺ said: “There is no day on which the people get up but two angels come down and one of them says, ‘O Allah, give in compensation to the one who spends (in charity),’ and the other says, ‘O Allah, destroy the one who withholds.”

Allah says in the Quran "Be steadfast in prayer and regular in charity. Whatever good you send forth for your souls before you, you shall find it with Allah. For Allah sees well all that you do" (2:110). 

Donate whatever you can even if it is little, Allah is the who rewards and he rewards greatly. None of us know which of our deeds will be the reason we are allowed to enter Jannah so donate even if it is little.
Title: Mueed's Jordan Refugee Fund

Description:
Asalamu Alaykum!

Muslim Hands has got a bread factory in Northern Syria! This Alhamdulilah provides thousands of loaves of bread every single day. 
This project mainly supporting orphans, widows and the elderly in the camps – including deliveries to the most vulnerable.

Just £10 feeds 130 people! And my aim this Ramadan is to feed 150,000!

Imagine giving just £10 and seeing those 130 people stood infront of you on the day of Judgement, and the reward you will get from Allah swt for feeding these people when they had nothing. 

Food is the greatest gift we can give and bread is a staple food in their diet, when people do not have anything, bread is a lifesaver. These children pick up grains of bread from amongst the rubble they live in, dirty and thrown away. But Alhamdulilah we will provide them fresh loaves! Imagine their joy!

Here's what the Qur'an says about feeding others:

'Or feeding, on a day of severe hunger, an orphan of near relationship, or a needy person in misery. And then being among those who believed and advised one another to patience and advised one another to compassion. Those are the companions of the right. [90:14-18]

'And they give (their own) food, in deep love of Allah, to
the needy, the orphan and prisoner (out of sacrifice, despite their own desire and need for it), (And say:) "We are feeding you only to please Allah. We do not seek any recompense from you nor (wish for) any thanks"'. [76:8-9]

Let's feed thousands of people this Ramadan <3
Title: Faisal's Let's feed the children of Syria

Description:
I've created a small recipe collection of some of my own favourites which you will recieve after donating an amount of your choice on this page. By buying this collection you will not only get the opportunity to perhaps try something new and find some inspiration for cooking, but you will also support the important work of the Felix Project so that they can continue to provide healthy meals and help the most vulnerable in our society. 

The mission of the Felix Project is simple - to take surplus food from their suppliers and deliver it to any charity that helps feed people. It's all nutritious and would otherwise go to waste. Not only that, but it helps fight food poverty and reduces costs for hardworking organisations.
Title: Quarantine Cooking

Description:
Help me save lives this Ramadan. 

Yemen now officially hosts the worlds largest human-induced food security crisis.

With the ongoing conflict in Yemen  already one of the poorest countries in the region  tens of thousands of lives have been lost and over 20 million people dont know where their next meal will come from. A country crippled by conflict is sadly now on the brink of famine.

Islamic Relief is on the ground in 19 of the countrys 22 governorates, providing essential food aid to families at risk of famine and facing extensive food insecurity.
 
With your support we can help these communities in their hour of need. For men, women and children across the country, finding their next meal is a growing challenge.

I am taking on the Ready, Steady, Iftar challenge to provide food for families in Yemen this Ramadan.

Description:
80% of women who street sex-work are homeless. One25 are a charity who work directly with street sex-working women to provide outreach, casework and essential resources for their future. 

In the strangest of times we now find ourselves in, One25 remain focused on keeping contact with women as much as possible and continuing to deliver services. They are doing whatever we can to make sure that some of Bristol's most vulnerable women know that they are loved and not alone.

This May, I will be giving up something for 125 hours. From 15 May (starting 1pm), till 20 May (ending 6pm).

Please donate to help women escape life on the streets.
Title: Give it up! 2020

Description:
YOUR DONATIONS WILL BE SPLIT 3-WAYS BETWEEN THE FELIX PROJECT, HOSPITALITY ACTION AND HOSPRO. MORE DETAILS BELOW

 Our Market Halls venues have become go-to destinations for eating and drinking in London over the last two years and sadly just over two months ago we were forced to close our doors due to coronavirus.

Our entire industry ground to a halt and we are now all navigating our way through these unprecedented times, probably the most difficult period our industry has ever faced.

The Market Halls Virtual Festival has been put together to hopefully bring some needed fun and positive energy to a weekend that traditionally sees people pouring into restaurants, bars, pubs and clubs all over the UK. It is also very important to us that we stay connected with our online community, our traders, suppliers, partners and industry during this pandemic, and we hope that this event will provide the platform for people to shine, share and connect.

The event plays host to 21 activations with everything from wellness mornings, to food and drink masterclasses, to acoustic sofa sessions. There is something for everyone of all ages, a full 'Market Halls at Home' experience.

We are working with 3 incredible charities and projects to support those that need help during this crisis. Your donations will be split 3-ways between The Felix Project, Hospitality Action and Hospro.

The Felix Project - collects fresh, nutritious food that cannot be sold. We deliver this surplus food to charities and schools so they can provide healthy meals and help the most vulnerable in our society.

Hospitality Action - deals with all the challenges that face the hospitality industry and those in it. From physical illness or mental health issues to financial difficulty, family problems to addiction - Hospitality Action is there to get you back on your feet again. And when it’s no longer possible to work, they can help you prepare for the next phase of your life. 

Hospro - is fighting mental health issues in hospitality with a supplement packed with 15 ingredients specifically chosen to improve areas of potential nutritional concern, caused by the hospitality lifestyle. 

We of course understand times are very tough so please only donate if you can and we are so grateful for any size of donation.

Thank you for taking the time to support us and we look forward to hopefully successfully raising our target of £3,000 and telling you the stories of where and how the money has helped people and our industry.

Stay safe.

The Market Halls Family x
