Description:
Hello, my name is Tom and I am 8 years old. I want to raise money to help people who have lost their jobs during covid-19 and do not have enough money for food and drinks.

The Trussell Trust is a charity which helps foodbanks all over the country. Foodbanks provide emergency food for the people that need it. I would like to help the foodbanks by asking my friends and family to donate a small amount of money to the Trussell Trust.

To thank you for your donation I will send you a happy heart or special star.I have created the special stars and happy hearts with clay at home then painted them with bright colours.

If you give some money it is likely that you are basically giving a meal to someone who needs it . Please give just a small amount of money to the foodbanks.

Stay well, love from Tom.
Title: Tom's Foodbank Fundraiser

Description:
If you are viewing this page, you have the chance to save a life, maybe multiple.

If there’s one thing the past few weeks have taught us, it’s to appreciate the freedom we have. Lockdown has proven a real test to all of us. This is just the tiniest of insights into how other people around the world live. Whilst we live comfortably around our families, there’s orphans living in dire conditions, with no future to look forward to. Whilst we are eating to our full, there’s mothers dying from starvation. For those of us who are fasting, there’s people who are forced to fast every day of the year. We could give you loads of reasons for you to donate, but the bottom line is, whilst we live in this life of luxury, there’s people suffering beyond comprehension. People are dying every day. Coronavirus doesn’t change the fate of these people, their struggling doesn’t get put on pause, it gets worse. 

We’ve all saved a bit of money from not going out in these tough times, we’ve all got a bit of cash in our pockets we don’t intend on spending. It costs as little as £50 to feed a family of 6 for one month. We are taking on the challenge to support 5 families. That’s 30 lives being saved, even if you can’t donate, send it to someone you know who can. Don’t just ignore this and think the next person will donate, be active, make others donate, for every pound they donate, that’s on you too, you raised that pound.

Islamic Relief helped about 1.3 million people last year, in 31 different countries. These people need our help again this year. If they don’t get this help, they’ll quite simply die, there’s no nice way to put it. This is the harsh reality

Please give what you guys can and share it out.

This project is Zakat, Lillah and Sadaqah applicable.

Thank you

Much love x

Mahir and Saleh

Description:
Quick and easy now as you can pay via:

Paypal

Google pay

Credit/Debit card


Many parts of the world have come to a standstill due to the recent outbreak of the Coronavirus (COVID-19) disease.

More than 950,000+ people globally have been infected with this flue like disease, which has taken more than 47,000 lives officially.

Looking into the current global crisis, iQra International has realised that despite the great quality of health services, first world countries are still finding it difficult to accommodate COVID-19 infected patients, as no cure is currently available.

iQra International has realised that the lack of support in third world countries must be at least -210% in comparison to the UK and other first world countries. 

We as iQra International have taken the initiative to support families who are suffering from the global effect of COVID-19, and prioritising the families of those who have a disabled child, in both Bangladesh and The Gambia.

A food pack costs £35 and a rice sack costs £25. A small donation of £60 will provide a family of 4 with just enough that will help them through this very difficult time.

Please show your support to this noble cause by donating now.


Follow our Instagram for more updates!
https://instagram.com/iqra_international?igshid=1gbtt5wmey63v

If you want to make any donation such as Fitrana (£5), general donation, food packs (£35), or anything else please see the details below. Make sure to reference your payment.

IQra international

Account 90400203

Description:
***UPDATE - we smashed our original target of £500 so we've increased it to £2000. Thank you so much to everyone for your support and please keep donating!! We've also smashed the mileage challenge so we've added extra miles on, and now we're also going to Murrayfield and back as well!***

Thanks for visiting the Gateshead RFC Twickenham Challenge fundraising page.

Over the May bank holiday weekend, players and club members from Gateshead RFC are coming together to raise money for Gateshead Foodbank.

Between us, we're aiming to run, walk and cycle the distance from Hedley Lawson Park, home of Gateshead RFC, to Twickenham Stadium, home of England Rugby, and then back. This is a total of 554 miles.

During this difficult period, we're hoping to support some of the most vulnerable people in our community by raising money for the local foodbank, where it will be used to provide emergency food packages for people and families in crisis.

Your donations will go to a great cause so please support the players and members by giving whatever you can to this great cause whilst they pound the streets

Description:
Alzheimer’s Society is transforming the landscape of dementia forever. Until the day we find a cure, we will create a society where those affected by dementia are supported and accepted, able to live in their community without fear or prejudice.

Let's come together as #OneTeam to have some fun and raise some much needed funds for our national charity.
Title: DGF UK's Big Bank Holiday Quiz

Description:
A cobbled together plan and a hastily assembled setup............

CV19 is causing chaos for the UK foodbanks and those that rely on them! they need help and fast.

I will be playing live via the magic of the internet for 12 hours from 9am - 9pm and where as i normally play techno on this occasion anything goes (if i have it or can get it).

I have a mic and unusually requests are welcome........with a small donation (anything at all)

I would love to raise even a hundred quid, it all helps

Please give the links a share :)

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Jon's Concrete Blocks 005 - Live 12 hour DJ set (anything goes)

Description:
We all know that many people can't get the food they need so if you put in a couple of bob I'll put up an embarrassing pic of myself from my formative years - how does that sound?

Please consider donating what you would have spent on train fare to come celebrate with me or buy me something pretty, or whatever you can spare - nothing would make me happier than to feel we've made a bit of a difference :D .

Why Trussel Trust? TT organise foodbanks across the country and campaign against food poverty. It is no accident that people go without food when there are no food shortages, and Trussel Trust work to "challenge the structural economic issues that lock people in poverty, and campaign to end the need for food banks in the UK."

This is what TT say: Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Thank you beautiful people <3

Title: Sharaz's Ramadan Food Pack Challenge

Description:
Lymphoma Action is the UK’s only charity dedicated to lymphoma, the fifth most common cancer. They’ve been providing in-depth, expert information and wide-ranging support for over 30 years, helping thousands of people affected by lymphoma. 

Almost 26 years ago, my dad, Seamus, passed away due to Non-Hodgkin's lymphoma. More than 13,000 people each year are diagnosed in the UK with this disease. It not only affects those diagnosed, but also countless family members and friends. Lockdown is a difficult and scary time for everyone especially for people who are vulnerable or who have conditions such as Non-Hodgkin's. It is situations such as these where the support work that charities, such as Lymphoma Action, carry out becomes so important.

Since lockdown has started, I've seen countless people doing brilliant fundraising for charities. Taking that into account (and the fact that no hairdressers are open!) I decided I am going to shave my head for charity! My partner, Han, is going to be trusted with the satisfying job of of shaving! God only knows what shape my head is under this hair.

Whether it is a couple of quid or more - any donation will be hugely appreciated!

Disclaimer - I am not going completely bald (despite some friends suggesting I should wet shave my head). But it is going to be very very short. The current plan is to use a beard shaver. But, with my fair hair, I'm sure there will be plenty of scalp on show!
Title: James's head shave challenge

Description:
On Saturday 9th May our team members; Hugh Johnson, David Shanks, Marion Paris, Helen Hogg & Jade Barclay will be participating in a series of events in the hope to gain sponsorship from yourselves to raise funds for Sebastian's Action Trust. The challenges are based around the London Marathon 2.6 Challenge:

  • Run 10KM
  • Complete as many miles on bike as possible within 1 hour
  • Complete 26,000 steps
  • An xbox endurance motor race for 6 hours
  • Run 2.6 Miles in 26 minutes 

Thank you for your support X

See below for a snippet of some of the work that Sebastian Action trusts does & the amazing work you'll be contributing to.

Sebastian's Action Trust supports families of seriously-ill children, walking alongside them from diagnosis, through treatment and beyond. We provide emotional, practical and social support to more than 600 families who have life-limited or life-threatened children. We support the whole family in the community, at the family home and at our two centres (Basingstoke and Crowthorne). We can't add days to lives, but we can - and do - add life to days.
Title: Bank Holiday Weekend 2.6 Challenge

CharityId: in England and Wales 1089464, Scotland SC041666
Description:
Ellie lost her Grandad to stomach Cancer in 2015 when he was aged 77 and she was aged 3, and when her baby sister was only 7 months old. He never got to meet her baby brother.  It was a trying time, because it is such a savage disease. His stomach cancer limited his ability to eat, and we could only helplessly watch on as he wasted away in front of us. We are thankful that he passed away peacefully on 4th December 2015 after his 2nd night at Woking Hospice, and we had 7 months to say our good byes.

Cancer has also affected a number of other family members and it would be great to prevent future suffering for all.

InTouch Foundation, Covid-19, Emergency food Provision

Covid-19 has had a major impact on individuals and their families. With a reduction in income combined with the lock down it has become increasingly difficult for many families to provide meals to their loved ones.

InTouch Foundation will be distributing ready meals to children and families in need. Partnering with local grassroots organisations to help distribute meals where the need is the greatest. Each meal costs £2.20 we are expecting to distribute over 30,000 meals in the coming weeks.

Title: InTouch Team Huddersfield Emergency Food Provision (Covid-19)

Description:
Freya and Struan’s Double Marathon Challenge

We wanted to complete a challenge during Lockdown to keep ourselves healthy and active. We have also been thinking of homeless people who don’t have a place to live and money to buy food because there is not many people in the city at the moment to help them so we have decided to raise money for Social Bite. 

Social Bite has had to close their cafes because of Covid-19 but has set up an emergency food delivery service to produce and deliver food and supplies to those who need them most during this time for as long as it is needed. 

This is going to be a difficult challenge but we wanted to do something we are going to find hard because we think it must be much harder to be homeless and hungry. 

We are going to run 2 miles every day for 26 days which is a total of 52 miles, the same distance as 2 full marathons. 

Thank you for your support!
Title: Freya and Struan Double Marathon Challenge

Description: The Hygiene Bank is a registered, people powered, grassroots charity grounded in community. We collect and re-distribute donated toiletries, hygiene, beauty and personal care items to UK charities, voluntary organisations and schools. These in turn are then given for free to their beneficiaries. Our passion stems from a sense of injustice: it's not right that anyone should face hygiene poverty in modern Britain

Title: Aisha's Ramadan Food Distribution

Description:
Over 20 Million people are in need spread over countries such as: Iraq, Yemen, Syrian Refugees, Rohingya Refugees, Gaza, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Somalia and Ghana.

Human Relief Foundation are on the ground in each of these areas providing much needed aid to families, widows, orphans and the elderly.

Escaping across borders, escaping bullets, fleeing from bombs, seeing the death of loved ones, to entering a new country they are trying to make home.

Daily struggles include no source of income and very little job opportunities. Around 70% of refugees live under the poverty line. There are very limited means to cover necessities such as food, water, clothing and in many cases, shelter. For most refugees, education is not even a priority in these circumstances.

Yes, the bombs are not falling from the skies and bullets are not filling their walls, but the hard times have not ceased. Every day is a struggle for most refugees and it is our job and responsibility that we all do what we can.

Following needs assessments, HRF provide food packs for families and Iftar everyday for the month of Ramadan:

Food packs - last a family of 5 for 1 month (Zakaat Applicable)

Iraq: £60
Syrian refugees (Jordan and Lebanon): £60
Yemen: £60
Gaza: £60
Ghana: £60
Somalia: £50
Rohingya Refugees: £45
Pakistan: £45
Bangladesh: £45

''Providing us with food and medication has been a backbone for me and my children, I desperately needed this medication and it means I have hope to stay alive for my children''

 - (Syrian widow with 6 children, residing in Jordan)

We need your help.

As a pillar of your faith, HRF handles your Zakaat donation with the upmost care. This means that 100% of the Zakaat you donate will be directed towards only the Most Needy of your choosing. If you wish to specify where you would like to send your Zakaat, please mention the country in your comment when you make the donation, otherwise it'll simply go to the most needy. If you require help in calculating your Zakat, please contact 0161 248 4048, or manchester@hrf.co.uk

Note: Sadaqah is also accepted on this page. 

If you see every individual's world, as the entire world, you will come to realise, every single person you help, is a world that has been changed. 

"There is no barrier between it [the Du'a of the oppressed person] and Allah". - Prophet Muhammad SAW

Please donate what you can and receive the Du'a of some of the most oppressed people on the planet

Jazakallah Khair 

Yusuf Ali Ather

 See your aid at work:

www.Facebook.com/HRFNorthwest

www.Instagram.com/HRFNorthwest


***P.S. Please don't forget to add gift aid to your donation at no extra cost to you. This will ensure that we get our admin and other operational costs covered to continue with our much needed work***

Title: AhlaamK's Ramadhan food parcel

Description:
Given the current economic climate, charities are being hit harder than most. We wanted to take this opportunity to support a foundation close to our hearts. 

Multiple Sclerosis is a devastating disease effecting both the brain and nervous system, resulting in a gradual deterioration of the bodies physical functions. Here at The Gym and Tonic Club we love to move, exercise and keep active and have enjoyed doing so even during our time in isolation. Unfortunately many MS sufferers do not have this luxury, however exercise and rehabilitation programmes have been shown to help slow the progression of the disease and improve overall function. 

On May 8th we will be hosting a free exercise class via zoom as well as on social media platforms. I would like to invite you to join us live on the screen for an hour of movement during the bank holiday in isolation. The class is free of charge, however we ask you to donate a whatever you can afford o help support this cause. For every participant, we will be donating £1.
Title: The Gym and Tonic Club Bank Holiday Charity Class

Description:
‘Abdullah ibn ‘Amr (r.A.) said, “A man asked the Prophet (ﷺ), “Which aspect of Islam is best?” He said, “feeding people and greeting those you know and those you do not know.” [Sahih Bukhari]

Firstly, I hope you and your family are safe and in good health.

Given the current crisis, we are able to witness ourselves what life is like with restrictions on our freedom. Now, imagine, this coupled with poverty is the reality of many families all across the globe.

This year we are raising funds for food parcels which we will be provding to families in less developed countries who are struggling to afford the bare necessities required for survival, and that's where you come in to make a change! 

We are aiming to provide a minimum of 100 food packs which will include essentials such as rice, lentils, oil, spices etc. The pack will feed roughly a family of 5, twice a day, for one month.  The cost of a food pack is £30, equivalent of feeding a family for £1 a day.

One Ummah provide food packs to 15 countries in total, we will be fundraising predominantly for Bangladesh, Pakistan and Syria.

If you wish to donate to a specific country please specify in your comment and it doesn't have to be the countries mentioned above, it can be any of the 15 countries which are listed below (we are trying to better anyone and everyones life!).

Bangladesh, Burma, Kenya, Lebanon, Mauritiana, Pakistan, Sierra Leone, Syria, Tanzania, Uganda, Yemen, Zimbabwe, Gaza, Afghanistan, Turkey

Please donate whatever is within your means and please please please share the link with your friends and family. Do not hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

May you be rewarded for all your efforts!

Note:  100% DONATION POLICY

Donations are both Sadaqah & Zakaat eligible (if your donation is Zakaat please specify in your comment)

Title: Sara's food pack

Description:
The people of Syria have endured over 8 years of war.

Official figures reveal that over 13 million people across Syria – which is above 70% of the population - are in urgent need of humanitarian aid, over 5 million of those being children. 7 million Syrians have been forced to flee their country, 13.5 million people need humanitarian aid within Syria, 60% of Syrian hospitals are now closed and 2.8 million Syrian children don’t go to school.



Penny Appeal’s emergency teams have been delivering aid in Syria since the war began, helping an amazing 144,668 Syrian people in the last 8 years.





COVID-19 has hit Syria and with their limited resources, an uncontrolled outbreak could be devastating.

With more than half of the country’s hospitals destroyed or damaged, the Syrian people are at extreme risk of a rapid spread of the coronavirus. There are six million internally displaced Syrians, many living in overcrowded refugee camps, with no way to protect themselves against this deadly virus


As the world turns its face away from Syria’s long and messy war, and the horrifying potential of an rapidly spreading coronavirus outbreak, terrified displaced Syrians are left wondering if anyone really cares.

But we care. And together, we can make a difference.

We will be providing food packs to 120 Syrian familes inside Syria as well as the Turkish border. 

The cost of one food pack is £50

Every donation – however small – helps Syrian people to survive.

Support Syria in their hour of greatest need.
Title: Food Packs for Syria With Love by Anisa and followers

Description:
In these troubled days we rely heavily on Health Services, care homes, good delivery services, good infrastructure, food and nutrition.

The coronavirus is a worldwide pandemic. Imagine you were in a country without a health service, without reliable food, where deliveries at best can be very unpredictable. Mary's Meals is working to provide children with regular food and nutrition in such countries. Usually Mary's Meals work through schools but because many schools are closed feeding stations have been set up. Fantastic work is being done but more needs to be done.

Each May at St Chrysostom's we do events to raise money for Mary's Meals. We are limited this year because of Coronavirus but we will still be trying because now more than ever the children Mary's Meals provide food for need our support. Six members of our church are doing a socially distanced walk or run at the end of May in a local park. Please generously support them - and in doing so feed children who need food in these troubled days. £15.90 is all it needs for Mary's Meals to feed a child school meals for an entire year. Amazing isn't it? 

Donating here through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Description:
We have already packed and distributed nearly 1000 food parcels to the elderly, victims of abuse, homeless and other vulnerable people in our community over the last couple of weeks. Some of the recipients of the parcels had not eaten for days and others were isolating due to severe illnesses like cancer. 

I will be continuing to distribute food parcels through the month of Ramadan to some of the most vulnerable people in our communities but I need your support to make sure we reach as many people as possible. 

The Prophet (ﷺ) was the most generous of all the people, and he used to become more generous in Ramadan when Gabriel met him. Gabriel used to meet him every night during Ramadan to revise the Qur'an with him. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) then used to be more generous than the fast wind. (Bukhari) 

Please donate generously.

(Peace be upon you and God’s mercy and blessings)

Description:
Oliver (aged 11) and Jacob (aged 8) are both super keen climbers who train with the Depot Climbing Academy and Oliver is a member of the GB Youth Climbing Team. Both of us are more used to climbing crags and walls, but want to use our skills to raise money for the Trussell Trust. 

On Saturday the 9th May 8.00 am, Oliver is completing 12 pull-ups and 12 push ups every hour for 12 hours, a total of 144 pull-ups and 144 press-ups. 

Jacob is completing 5 pull-ups and 5 press-ups every hour for 12 hours. A total of 60 pull-ups and 60 press-ups. 

This works out to a grand total of 204 press-ups and 204 pull-ups between us. 

This is 408 pull-ups and press-ups in 12 hours. 

Please support us to raise more money for this great charity at this difficult time. Please see more below

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Description:
Having seen in the news a few days ago that the demand for items from food banks has increased by 80% due to individuals losing their jobs or simply struggling to make ends meet - I wanted to do something to support these people.

I have therfore set my self the challenge of running 30 miles (minimum) on the 8th May to coincide with the VE celebrations.(I will stop and pay my respects at 11am with my family).

I will be running laps of the road that I live on (with the consent of the residents). In order to reach 30 miles I will need to run up and down the road 150 times. Once I have reached 30 miles I will try and continue for as long as my body holds out!

The furthest I have ever run is 26.2 miles several years ago.

Please support this very important and much needed cause by giving even a small amount if you can - any amount will help those who are in need at this time.

Thank you.

Richard

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

As we face the consequences of the Covid-19 pandemic throughout the world, poor people in rural communities facing lock down are more desperate than ever before.  I am hugely concerned about the welfare of most vulnerable: Orphans, widows and needy families. 

In Pakistan, where READ Foundation carries out a lot of its charitable work, it has over 11,000 orphan children in its 390 schools who rely entirely on the generosity of people like yourself. Their work is phenomenal as they help transform lives of needy children through education. I have seen this for myself when I helped organise one of their events in London. 

Our target is to provide at least 100 Food packs with your help inshallah but you can donate whatever you can. Every penny counts! Each food pack will support a poor family of 6 for the whole month. 

  • £125 can provide a vulnerable family with a food parcel containing staple foods for a month and also medical hygiene kits. 
  • £75 can provide a vulnerable family with a pack containing enough staple foods for a month. 
  • £50 can provide a medical hygiene kit for a vulnerable family 

Or you can donate any amount you would like.

This Ramadan help desperate orphan children and struggling families to survive. 

Your Zakat & Sadaqa could save their lives. May Allah SWT accept our donations. Ameen.

Description:
I am inviting pupils in Movilla High School to enter an art competition to create a poster celebrating the National Health Service heroes in the UK. Pupils are creating this poster as part of their online art learning. If they wish, they can donate £3 to the Children's Hospice to enter their poster into the competition. Our Hospice workers are doing an even more amazing job at the minute, sometimes being the only "family" their patients will have during the Covid-19 pandemic. There will be an Art Supply goody-bag for the competition winner. Please read below for more info on the charity and fundraising platform.

NOTE: pupils do NOT have to enter this competition as part of the online course. If they do not wish to do so, they can simply submit their work to me as usual.

Info on Children's Hospice:

The only service of its kind in NI, Children's Hospice cares for over 370 babies, children and young people each year at our dedicated Children's in-patient unit - Horizon House and in our local communities through our Specialist Community Nursing Team. Our work also extends to families, supporting them from the point of diagnosis right through to the grieving period after bereavement. We receive a small amount of government funding, so we rely on the generosity of our local community to help us to continue to deliver our vital service.

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

William Fox (Bill, Billy the Fish) passed away on 17 April 2020 At Watlington Nursing Home. Dad was a proud Glaswegian who convinced us all he was West of Scotland Junior champion at everything from Ballroom dancing to darts to table tennis! A sense of humour, a passion for Celtic FC and an ingrained sense of justice that he was always willing to share over a pint.

Dad was always feeding people or buying them a drink. Education and help for those less fortunate was also dear to his heart, so the family thought that this Scottish based charity ticked all the boxes.
Title: William Fox

Description:
DJ Imi 6 Hour Non Stop Live Mix, Saturday May 9 from 6 pm

https://youtu.be/19zCiG1GoAM

For the past 6 weeks, most of us have been spending 99% of our time at home.  However 10,000s of brave people are spending almost all of their time selflessly helping others.  These heroes, otherwise known as the NHS, are committed to defeating Covid 19 and risking (and tragically in some cases sacrificing) their own lives.

What am I doing about it?: I am not exactly running a marathon or swimming the Channel....but instead I'd like to share the music that I love over the course of a 6 hour non stop live DJ set, via You Tube.

When: 6:00 pm to 12:00 am, Saturday May 9 (you WILL be staying in so you might as well listen!)

Where:  You Tube (link to follow)

In return, all I ask is for you to make a contribution not to me, but to NHS Charities Together....and to share this link. 

Thank you

Imi

Title: Get Down In Lockdown!   DJ Imi 6 Hour Non Stop Live Mix

Description:
Ramadan Mubarak, I pray you you are making the most of this blessed month.

Food supply chains have been disrupted by COVID-19. Those most vulnerable around the world can’t even get the basics such as food they need to survive. Your Sadaqah and Zakat has the power to help change this.

This Ramadan I have committed to feeding 50 families in some of the poorest parts of the world for the entire month with Islamic Relief. 

We know that these times are tough on everyone, but Allah (SWT) has given us the answer. Allah has told us that Sadaqah protects us from calamity and sickness. He even tells us that giving charity increases your sustenance! Allah is indeed the most generous.

£50 can help provide food for one family for the entire month, as little as £10 will provide food for one person for the entire month. Please donate generously
Title: Atique's Ramadan Food Pack Appeal

Description:
As the world is gripped by a global pandemic and we approach the blessed month of Ramadan, more and more families will be in desperate need of assistance with food. 

For only £10, you can help provide someone with Iftar and Suhoor this Ramadan! 


Its simple, £10 will feed one person this Ramadan! And yes, you can give your Zakat for this. 

  • ​Bangladesh
    Pakistan
    Rohingya Refugees 
    Yemen*
    Gaza*
    Syrian Refugees*
    Palestinian Refugees*
    Tanzania
    Cameroon 
    Central African Republic 
Whatever is donated will be distributed among these countries. 
  • Food packs being prepared for Ramadan 2020: https://youtu.be/laLQ19AsJnA
  • Food in some of these countries are  slightly more expensive and £10 might not cover the entire month of Ramadan however it will cover the majority of it.

JazakAllah Kahir,

Nazmin Begum

Islamic Help is a UK-registered charity delivering sustainable solutions that empower people in need. Our work is underpinned by our core values – honesty, transparency, integrity and accountability.Since launch, we've empowered over 10 million people worldwide.Over the past 17 years, we have provided urgent aid and sustainable relief to thousands of disadvantaged people across the globe, including right here in the UK.
Title: Nazmin's Ramadan Food Pack

Description:
Thank you for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

In these troubled times, and inspired by one of Olympia's classmates, we decided to find a way to help those in need for food. Because of the current crisis, 1 in 8 people are going hungry everyday around the world and this number is likely to rise.

With this in mind, we came up with a family & friends challenge of our own and we hope this inspires each and everyone one of you to help us raise as much money as possible. We aim to cumulatively run and cycle 150k between the 6 of us. 

The race will take place in London & Lanzarote. Theodora (4yr) will run 2k, Olympia (7yr) will run 10k and thereafter jump on her bike and continue on her bike until the finish line, Marta (50yr) will run 12k and cycle the remaining distance, Jojo (36yr) will run 24k, Colin (33yr) will run 50k @ less than 4:00 per km! whilst Nico will cycle and film the challenge. This is Theodora’s, Olympia’s, Marta’s, Jojo’s and Colin's longest ever running distances!

We chose to support Akshaya Patra – Unlimited Food for Education
because no child deserves to go hungry and be deprived of a future. We feel that Akshaya’s focus on nourishing children and encouraging education during this crisis is important. Why India? About 30% of the world’s malnourished children live in India with malnutrition accounting for half of child deaths within the country and 1 in 11 are labouring instead of going to school.

During the COVID crisis, Akshaya Patra has been serving food every
single day. And whilst they started serving 21k meals back in March, they are now reaching 1.4m meals daily as the crisis has hit more and more people in need.    

Please help us by sponsoring our challenge to give us all the energy
we will need to reach the finish line and, together, we can play our part in helping during this crisis. (and if you would like to add your own challenge so we can inspire even more donations, just let us know!)

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure.
Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send
unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

THANK YOU

Nico, Jojo, Marta, Colin, Olympia and Theodora

Description:
This Ramadan many families will be going hungry beyond Iftari time (the time to open fasts). You can make a difference. Your donation will help deprived families this Ramadan have the food they need to help combat poverty and nutritional deficiency.

Your donations will help give some of the world’s poorest and neediest people the essential food they need to have a nutritious iftar meal.

As the Prophet (saw) said:

‘Whoever gives Iftar to one who is fasting will have a reward like his, without that detracting from the reward of the fasting person in the slightest.’ (Tirmidhi)

Make A Change With Your Change

May Allah swt reward you for your effort and donation  💗
Title: Ramadan 2020 food packs

Description:
Lola and Billie spent the first week of lockdown delivering leaflets with vital numbers on for Kippax residents so they could reach out if they needed help or food! 

Garforth NET was one of the numbers  on the leaflet and currently they deliver over 60 food hampers a day to Kippax alone!

We want to raise funds as the cupboards of NET are running low and some Kippax residents rely heavily on their food donations to their door!
Title: Lola and Billie do 100 miles for food!

Description:
Clare Mount is a Special Needs School - COVID-19 lockdown has meant that many of our families are struggling to get access to basic foods. Maybe their children are autistic and cannot cope with social distancing measures so cannot go out in public safely. Maybe they are shielding for medical reasons. Maybe they have very limited incomes which won't stretch far enough to keep their growing teens at home fed.

We would like to show we care, by raising some funds to make sure none of families go hungry during this period.
Title: Clare Mount Vulnerable Families Food Parcels

Description:
SYF Currently on the grounds of Tharparkar & Africa. Due to recent break out of COVID-19 it has affected the people leaving the people in extreme harsh conditions of no access to food. 

Our amazing volunteers are currently out in Tharparkar, distributing food aid. 

Just £25 can provide food packs for the needy families in Tharparkar. 

*Please help these families today. Your donations truly make a difference! 

#Tharparkar #COVID19 #AidDeployment #FoodAid

Title: Isas Food Pack Challenge

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

As we face the consequences of the Covid-19 pandemic throughout the world, poor people in rural communities facing lock down are more desperate than ever before.  I am hugely concerned about the welfare of most vulnerable: Orphans, widows and needy families. 

In Pakistan, where READ Foundation carries out a lot of its charitable work, it has over 11,000 orphan children in its 390 schools who rely entirely on the generosity of people like yourself. Their work is phenomenal as they help transform lives of needy children through education. I have seen this for myself when I attended one of their events in London. 

Our target is to provide at least 100 Food packs with your help inshallah but you can donate whatever you can. Every penny counts! Each food pack will support a poor family of 6 for the whole month. 

  • £125 can provide a vulnerable family with a food parcel containing staple foods for a month and also medical hygiene kits. 
  • £75 can provide a vulnerable family with a pack containing enough staple foods for a month. 
  • £50 can provide a medical hygiene kit for a vulnerable family 

Or you can donate any amount you would like.

This Ramadan help desperate orphan children and struggling families to survive. 

Your Zakat & Sadaqa could save their lives. May Allah SWT accept our donations. Ameen.

Title: Lubna's COVID-19 EMERGENCY APPEAL

Description:
As the Coronavirus outbreak continues to spread across the world, the spread in Kenya has started to take hold, several weeks / months behind Europe. With social distancing and lockdown / curfews, one of the biggest issues facing the most vulnerable is the reality of starvation. It is forecast that 150,000 people will starve in Kajiado County, accounting for 30% of the population living in this County. 

Memusi is responding in a number of ways:

1. SMART AID & Food Aid - supporting people who are facing into starvation. With markets closed and lockdown & curfew in place, peoples support mechanisms have fallen away overnight and those with livestock not able to trade. Through SMART Aid, we will unlock the capital of traders helping people to eat, with the funds supporting local economy & future employment 

2. Fight against COVID-19 - soap, masks and awareness training - working alongside local partners to deliver support in the fight against the spread in rural Kenya
Title: Angela's Helping a little community access food

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.

As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Andrew's Dying his hair pink to raise money for The Trussell Trust

Description:
Over 20 Million people are in need spread over countries such as: Iraq, Yemen, Syrian Refugees, Rohingya Refugees, Gaza, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Somalia and Ghana.

Human Relief Foundation are on the ground in each of these areas providing much needed aid to families, widows, orphans and the elderly.

Escaping across borders, escaping bullets, fleeing from bombs, seeing the death of loved ones, to entering a new country they are trying to make home.

Daily struggles include no source of income and very little job opportunities. Around 70% of refugees live under the poverty line. There are very limited means to cover necessities such as food, water, clothing and in many cases, shelter. For most refugees, education is not even a priority in these circumstances.

Yes, the bombs are not falling from the skies and bullets are not filling their walls, but the hard times have not ceased. Every day is a struggle for most refugees and it is our job and responsibility that we all do what we can.

Following needs assessments, HRF provide food packs for families and Iftar everyday for the month of Ramadan:

Food packs - last a family of 5 for 1 month (Zakaat Applicable)

Iraq: £60
Syrian refugees (Jordan and Lebanon): £60
Yemen: £60
Gaza: £60
Ghana: £60
Somalia: £50
Rohingya Refugees: £45
Pakistan: £45
Bangladesh: £45

''Providing us with food and medication has been a backbone for me and my children, I desperately needed this medication and it means I have hope to stay alive for my children''

 - (Syrian widow with 6 children, residing in Jordan)

We need your help.

As a pillar of your faith, HRF handles your Zakaat donation with the upmost care. This means that 100% of the Zakaat you donate will be directed towards only the Most Needy of your choosing. If you wish to specify where you would like to send your Zakaat, please mention the country in your comment when you make the donation, otherwise it'll simply go to the most needy. If you require help in calculating your Zakat, please contact 0161 248 4048, or manchester@hrf.co.uk

Note: Sadaqah is also accepted on this page. 

If you see every individual's world, as the entire world, you will come to realise, every single person you help, is a world that has been changed. 

"There is no barrier between it [the Du'a of the oppressed person] and Allah". - Prophet Muhammad SAW

Please donate what you can and receive the Du'a of some of the most oppressed people on the planet

Jazakallah Khair 

Uzma Akhtar

See your aid at work:

www.Facebook.com/HRFNorthwest

www.Instagram.com/HRFNorthwest


***P.S. Please don't forget to add gift aid to your donation at no extra cost to you. This will ensure that we get our admin and other operational costs covered to continue with our much needed work***

We will use any money donated here to deliver food parcels to those in the greatest need. Educate the Kids has operated here for 22 years and have the infrastructure in place to make difference.

Description: This Ramadan, Penny Appeal is reaching out to millions of hungry people in around 30 crisis-hit countries to put an end to food insecurity. This will provide healthy, nutrient-rich meals to impoverished families throughout Asia, Africa and the Middle East.
Title: Amina & Hasan Fundraising

Description:
Since the lockdown, the Food Foundation has reported that more than 1.5 million Britons are reported not eating for a whole day because they have no money or access to food. 

To support in those extraordinary times, we are currently in the process to work with local mosques to provide food pack to families in need. 

Why entering the challenge? 
The reason number one is to multiply your good deeds during this blessed month. It's a chance to be in a position to support less fortunate, and we should be embracing it. 
Finally, as a mean to strengthen our relationship with Allah, this challenge will help you maximise its benefit by better connecting your body and your mind.
Title: Zeinab's Core challenge

Description:
Times may be unsettling but right now charities need our help more than ever, which is why we’re challenging staff to Move for Macmillian. 

Paragon colleagues are pledging to individually cycle, run or walk a total of 25k, 50k, 100k or 200k across the month of May
Title: Paragon's Move For Macmillan

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page. 

Operation Khair are teaming up with Ummah Welfare Trust this year to provide emergency food parcels for families in Yemen. Ummah welfare trust operate a 100% donation policy and have partners delivering effective aid to those who need it most.

Just 1 food parcel costs £65 and will feed a family of 6 for over 1 month. 

The contents of each parcel are;

  • Ground wheat 25kg 
  • White flour 25 kg
  • Rice 20 kg
  • Sugar 10 kg
  • Sunflower Oil 5 litres 
  • Kedari Sauce
  • Dates 8kg 
  • Milk powder 900 grams
  • Tang powder juice 1 kg
  • Pasta
  • Salt 2 kg
Title: Emergency Food Aid for Yemen 2020

Description:
We are all staying at home so We are going to camp and cook outside for 1 night. The only time allowed into the house is for the toilet and washing hands after. 

You can participate or not but please part donate what ever you can even the cost of one ice cream will help. 

The Mental Health Foundation is the UK’s charity for everyone’s mental health.With prevention at the heart of what they do, the Mental Health Foundation aim to find and address the sources of mental health problems so that people and communities can thrive.

Title: Food for the Most Needy

CharityName: The Last Night A DJ Saved My Life Foundation
Description:
URGENT APPEAL


This is an URGENT appeal to help Last Night A DJ Saved My Life's partner charities in developing countries & their communities to survive the drastic effects of lockdown & try to prevent the spread of the virus. Your donations will provide food, clean water and sanitation supplies to the most vulnerable.In many of the locations we support, people live hand to mouth, day to day. The strict lockdown is disastrous for these people. One day without work can mean no food that day.Thanks to our trusted relationships at the grassroots level, we can get help quickly and directly to those in most need.Your contribution can make a HUGE difference! For example, just £20 can feed a family of four for a month in Uganda.At LNADJ we have long believed that harnessing the power of music can make a huge difference and literally save lives. Now, in the midst of this global crisis its needed more than ever.More info: https://www.lastnightadjsavedmylife.org/setforlove-streaming-love/

Title: Azar 's COVID-19 EMERGENCY APPEAL

Description:
My name is Matteo and I’m 13 years old. My 10 year old twin siblings, Orlando & Raphaella and I are trying to raise money for hot meals and personalised food parcels for the most vulnerable in North London. Things are particularly tough there at the moment. 

We are riding our bikes 1000 kilometres round the country lanes and fields near our home to raise £2,000. This money will go directly to the Irish Centre in North London to distribute meals and food to those in the community (Irish & non-Irish) most needing them. Sadly these meals are often the only hot food these people eat all week and the deliverers their only visitors. Some of them are isolated through the pandemic, others are isolated through physical or mental health issues. A hot meal or personalised food parcel can be the highlight of their week. 

We wonder if you could spare a little something to help these people by clicking on the link below. Every tiny bit helps and my sister and brother and I can't thank you enough for your support.  

Matt, Orl & Raphaella
Title: Matt, Orl & Raphaella's 500km Bikeathon

Description:
• More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life.
  • Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.
  • Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.
  • Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Video  Covid 19 Social Distancing song is on YouTube  9P621KsVAPs
Title: The Social Distancing song on YouTube

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: The Food Glorious Food Challenge

Description:
Hi, my name is Paul Pearce, Director & Financial Adviser @ Prudens Financial Protection Ltd.  I’ve been thinking long and hard about how I can support people during the Coronavirus outbreak?  I’ve come to the decision that I’d love to support something local.

Therefore, I’ve decided to set up this Just Giving page to support the amazing work done by the ‘Ormskirk Foodbank Charity’.  Charity No. 1185980.

Due to Coronavirus, it’s been reported there is still extra demand
on food banks and Ormskirk Foodbank are working now to help people in need of these services.  All money raised will go straight to Ormskirk Foodbank Charity account.

So, rather than going to the supermarket and buying extra
food & hygiene products, the best way would be to donate through this page. 

I’m kicking off the support with a donation of £250.00 

I fully understand with so many people being Furloughed by
their own employers, it is a tough time to ask people to donate, but “if” you have a spare £1 or £2, that’s enough to buy some tins of food… so let’s see how much community spirit we have here in Ormskirk and help those who need it most.

Finally, if you are wondering who and how this helps… Ormskirk Foodbank, working with doctors, health visitors, social workers and Citizens Advice, identify the people who need help the most and a foodbank voucher is issued.  The voucher is redeemed and
provides for three days of emergency food.

Thank you for taking the time to read this and stay safe & well.

Paul

Title: Prudens Financial Protection Ormskirk Foodbank Fundraising

Description: We are going to perform a massive dance routine with current students , past students , parents and volunteers to raise funds for the brave staff who have supported and worked continuously through the COVID19 outbreak.
Title: gillian's Gillian Banks Theatre School Dance for superheroes

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page. 

The World Health Organisation has declared the Coronavirus outbreak a global pandemic which has spread to more than 190 countries across the globe. There are over 2 million cases which is increasing daily with a total loss of 115,000+ lives lost. 

Whilst many of us have a roof over our head and the everyday essentials we need, 1/3 of the worlds population (2.5 billion people) have no access to basic essentials such as food and medicine for their health. 

To aid some of the worlds poorest countries that have weaker healthcare systems and are home to those that are more at risk, Muslim Global Relief is committed to supporting  vulnerable communities both in the UK and globally. Millions are already living in extreme poverty with the added threat of Coronavirus which has already devastated  many communities. 

All and any donations raised will go to Muslim Global Relief in order to fund food parcels and nutritious meals alongside providing hygiene kits for those that need it most. Especially during this holy month of Ramadan where millions of Muslims across the world will fast with no food to break their fast with - something which many of us easily can take for granted. 

Emergency food and hygiene packs - £50                       Medical kits - £100 (providing front line medical officials with PPE such as medical masks/gloves, disposable surgical gloves, medical goggles and hand sanitisers)

The Prophet (saw) said ‘Give charity without delay, for it stands in the way or calamity’. (Tirmidhi)

Every little donation will make a massive difference - thank you❤️
Title: Emergency Food/Hygiene packs

CharityName: Great Ormond Street Hospital Children's Charity
Description:
I'm hosting a quiz for Great Ormond Street Hospital Children's Charity (GOSH Charity) as they face an unprecedented challenge with the COVID-19 crisis. 

As GOSH plays a role in the national response to the COVID-19 crisis by treating more children from hospitals across London, resources will become increasingly stretched.   

The hospital needs the support of Great Ormond Street Hospital Children's Charity (GOSH Charity) now more than ever, so it can continue to deliver the best, life-saving care for seriously ill children.

Let's stay connected in this virtual world by having our very own GOSH quiz!
Title: Bank Holiday Quiz for GOSH

Description:
Even in normal times, the children at Bright Sparks School in north India have difficult lives. Now, with the lock-down,  their situation has become extreme. All work has stopped and their parents cannot earn.

They are queuing for daily 'langar', cooked food provided by local Sikh temples. But there is not enough to feed everyone twice daily. One plate of food is given per family.

Bright Sparks has already sent some emergency funds. We need to raise more. Small shops and veg stalls remain open. We want to help the families fend for themselves.

Please donate any amount, and please pass this request on to friends. Thanks so much.

Donating through JustGiving is totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity.
Title: Covid19 emergency appeal for Bright Sparks families

Description:
Instead of running 26 miles in the London Marathon (which has been cancelled and which I wasn’t going to be taking part in, anyway), I’m painting 26 postcards of Norfolk wildlife and will use them to acknowledge, with thanks, all donations made to The Trussell Trust. Thus, I have an enjoyable task to help occupy the time on my hands while also doing something useful. What you do with the cards is up to you. They have no real value but they may make your fridge doors look a bit colourful.

Here’s why I think The Trussell Trust is a worthy cause...

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that they’re able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: John's London 26 Painted Postcards Marathon

Description:
NHS staff and volunteers are doing amazing work right now in caring for COVID-19 patients.Together, let's show our respect and gratitude as they work tirelessly in the face of the virus. It's our turn to make sure we look after them, to ensure they can keep doing their vital work.

My name is Honey-Rose and I am 10 years old. I am the most fussiest eater ever. For the NHS I want to raise money by trying a new food every day for 30 days. So far I have tried carrots and sweetcorn. Today's challenges is PEAS.
Title: Honey-Rose Food Challenge for the NHS

Title: Gives food to the hunger

Description: To a hungry family struggling to find food for Iftar, one simple donation can be a lifeline. Now is the time to give. Donate your zakat, sadaqah, fidyah or for the sake of humanity. May allah swt reward you for your efforts and bless you in this world and the hereafter. I was so touched by some of the videos seen by human appeal and what the real reality is for some people and how we wouldn’t even imagine living in those circumstances.. Alhamdulillah for everything we have and allah swt has given us and will continue to give us inshaalah.. Just remember if you give today Allah swt will give you more tomorrow inshaalah..
Title: Feeding a fasting family this Ramadan

Description:
Orphans and young children are one of the most vulnerable groups in the world, and face multiple child protection risks, including psychosocial distress, child labour, child marriage and other forms of exploitation and abuse. 

How can you make a difference? 

£420 can cover all the essential needs of an orphaned child including: Nutritious food, clean water,  clothing, medical care and education.

The Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) said: “I and the one who sponsors an orphan will be in Paradise like these two” – and he gestured with his forefinger and middle finger, holding them close together.


To a hungry family struggling to find food for iftar, one simple donation can be a lifeline.  One donation of £70 can make a difference to a family in Bangladesh, Lebanon, Iraq, Pakistan, Palestine, Somalia, Syria, Turkey or Yemen.

Each parcel will provide a family of five to seven for the whole month with enough essential and nutritious food.

“He is not a believer who fills his stomach while his neighbour goes hungry.” 

(Bukhari)

Now is the Time to Give!

May Allah reward you abundantly!
Title: Orphans and Food

Description:
SubhanAllah we've all felt the effects of Coronavirus. Many of us have struggled with sickness or day-to-day life in isolation, and sadly many have lost loved ones. 

Around the world, there's a global food shortage due to supplies being disrupted by Coronavirus. Families living in poverty in places like Gaza, Somalia and Syria don't have the luxury of stockpiling food.

This is why we're calling on YOU to help keep vulnerable people around the people safe during the blessed month of Ramadan and take on the challenge to help feed just ONE FAMILY this Ramadan by fundraising for one food pack, which costs just £50.
Title: Muriam's Ramadan Food Pack Challenge

Description:
*UPDATE: seeing the amazing response I have increased the goal to 720 so each countries would get 4 packs of food parcels (Gaza, Syria and Pakistan)

Hey, 

Thank you for visiting this page :) As you all know due to the Coronavirus and lockdown, a lot of people did bulk buying and we all experienced shortage of food supplies that we wanted but can you imagine ours lasted for a week or so but for these people it’s possibly a lifetime? Having experienced it and experiencing the discomfort of hunger in Ramadan, I urge you all to please donate, even if it’s just £1. With 40k following on Instagram even if I get each of you to pay £1 I would eventually make something amazing out of this initiative.

This Ramadan I'll be supporting HRF to raise money to provide food packs for our brothers and sisters around the world. 

HRF gives food packs to families  in Pakistan, Gaza and Syria this Ramadan please help me feed 10 families.  

Please donate on this page to give our brothers and sister food parcels throughout this blessed month!  Imagine being the reason someone has food for iftar/shuoor every single day of Ramadan. 

I'll be raising money towards food packs which will can provide enough to feed an entire family for a whole month, In sha Allah – Aiming to feed between 5 to 6 people from each family's home. One food parcel is £60 - Your donations can be towards sadaqah or zakat to feed families across the world. 

The Prophet Muhammad SAW said: "Whoever gives food for a fasting person to break his fast, he will have a reward like theirs, without that detracting from their reward in the slightest." 

Thank you so much for your support. 

P.s if you're a UK tax payer please don't forget to tick the box, this way we'll be able to get extra 25% without any extra payment from you.
Title: Ramadan Food Packs

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.

As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Georgina's Face Masks for Food

Description:
Sponsor an Orphan for a Year!

There are an estimated 153 million orphans worldwide, with around 5,700 more children becoming orphans, every day. As the most vulnerable members of society, they often face hunger, disease, exploitation and extreme cycles of poverty they will never break out of. Orphans desperately need our help.

The Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) said: “I and the one who sponsors an orphan will be in Paradise like these two” – and he gestured with his forefinger and middle finger, holding them close together"

This Ramadan we are looking to sponsor 240 Orphans through #TeamPurple and we need YOUR help to do so.

We are also aiming to feed as many fasting families this Ramadan with food packs of just £70 which will provide a family of five with a food parcel with enough nutritious food for the whole month of Ramadan. HELP US REACH 100K!

£35 - sponsors an orphan for 1 month

£420 - Sponsors an Orphan for the year

£70 - will provide a family of five with a food parcel with enough nutritious food for the whole month of Ramadan.
Title: Ebrahem's x5 Orphans: Food, Clothing, Medicine and Shelter

Description:
Story

Over 20 Million people are in need spread over countries such as: Iraq, Yemen, Syrian Refugees, Rohingya Refugees, Gaza, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Somalia and Ghana.

Human Relief Foundation are on the ground in each of these areas providing much needed aid to families, widows, orphans and the elderly.

Escaping across borders, escaping bullets, fleeing from bombs, seeing the death of loved ones, to entering a new country they are trying to make home.

Daily struggles include no source of income and very little job opportunities. Around 70% of refugees live under the poverty line. There are very limited means to cover necessities such as food, water, clothing and in many cases, shelter. For most refugees, education is not even a priority in these circumstances.

Yes, the bombs are not falling from the skies and bullets are not filling their walls, but the hard times have not ceased. Every day is a struggle for most refugees and it is our job and responsibility that we all do what we can.

Following needs assessments, HRF provide food packs for families and Iftar everyday for the month of Ramadan:

Food packs - last a family of 5 for 1 month (Zakaat Applicable)

Iraq: £60
Syrian refugees (Jordan and Lebanon): £60
Yemen: £60
Gaza: £60
Ghana: £60
Somalia: £50
Rohingya Refugees: £45
Pakistan: £45
Bangladesh: £45

''Providing us with food and medication has been a backbone for me and my children, I desperately needed this medication and it means I have hope to stay alive for my children''

 - (Syrian widow with 6 children, residing in Jordan)

We need your help.

As a pillar of your faith, HRF handles your Zakaat donation with the upmost care. This means that 100% of the Zakaat you donate will be directed towards only the Most Needy of your choosing. If you wish to specify where you would like to send your Zakaat, please mention the country in your comment when you make the donation, otherwise it'll simply go to the most needy. If you require help in calculating your Zakat, please contact 0161 248 4048, or manchester@hrf.co.uk

Note: Sadaqah is also accepted on this page. 

If you see every individual's world, as the entire world, you will come to realise, every single person you help, is a world that has been changed. 

"There is no barrier between it [the Du'a of the oppressed person] and Allah". - Prophet Muhammad SAW

Please donate what you can and receive the Du'a of some of the most oppressed people on the planet

Jazakallah Khair 

Muzammil Ahmed

 See your aid at work:

www.Facebook.com/HRFNorthwest

www.Instagram.com/HRFNorthwest


***P.S. Please don't forget to add gift aid to your donation at no extra cost to you. This will ensure that we get our admin and other operational costs covered to continue with our much needed work***
Title: Food for the Most Needy

Description:
Emergency Youth Task Force

An emergency is a serious and dangerous situation where we have to act quick to save lives. Even the youth can TAKE ACTION to save the day.

We are taught to help all people as much as we are able. Rasulullah SAW explained that the Muslim Ummah is like one body (in caring and compassion) and that if one part of us is hurting, all of us will feel the pain too and it is up to us to make it better.


Mission:

Make as much money as possible this Ramadhan to give to Ummah Welfare Trust (UWT) who will buy food packs for families in Yemen.


How?

1 - USING YOUR HARD WORK

- Select chores/jobs you can do for family that you know they hate doing and would gladly pay you for. Do a great job, and charge a great fee. Do as many of these as you can in Ramadhan and save up the money to give to UWT.

2 - USING YOUR COMMUNICATION SKILLS

- Make a list of family members or good friends whom you can convince to send money to UWT for Yemen. Keep on calling them, this Ramadhan to remind them to send the money, UNTIL IT IS DONE!


Mission Accomplished

Keep a record of how much money you raised and send your name and details to Operation Khair who will post you a certificate of appreciation in the post.

OperationKhair.team@gmail.com
Title: Emergency Youth Task Force

Title: Food for the Most Needy

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

As we face the consequences of the pandemic in the UK, poor people in many countries facing lock down are more desperate than ever before.  We are hugely concerned about the welfare of most vulnerable : Orphans and widows and needy families. 

In Pakistan where READ Foundation carries out a lot of its charitable work, has over 11,000 orphan children in its 390 schools who rely entirely on the generosity of people like yourself. 
 

Our target is to provide at least 100 Food packs with your help inshallah. You can donate whatever you can. Each food pack will support a poor family of 6 for the whole month. 

Your Sadaqa,  Zakat, Sadqa-tul- fitr and Fidya could save their lives. May Allah SWT accept our donations. Ameen 

(Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails.
 Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.)
Title: FOOD PACK APPEAL

Description:
In South Sudan half the population are displaced and live in camps. Due to coronavirus there is hunger, misinformation and mistrust. The war that has lasted 6 years may start again.

Rights for Peace works with youth leaders like Mabior, who lives in Adjumani refugee camp in Northern Uganda. Food there has been reduced to less than 1 meal per day. There is widespread misinformation about Covid-19 with little knowledge about hand washing and how the virus spreads.

Rights for Peace is providing awareness raising in camps, countering misinformation and divisions. They need your support right now.
Title: Lara and Lily's 2.6 Challenge:

Description:
Assalamu alaikum (Peace be upon you)!

Yemen is currently in the grips of one of the worst humanitarian crises the world has ever seen. The impending corona virus isn’t the biggest danger our Yemeni brothers and sisters will face this year, but rather hunger and cholera are their two biggest enemies.29 million Yemenis are currently still in Yemen. 80% of the population are in need of some form of humanitarian assistance and 15 million are on the brink of starvation, due to diminishing access to food. With the world locked in, people are thinking closer to home, but millions will die including children, women and the elderly if we cannot maintain our support for them.

UBISOC is teaming up with Mercy Relief, a Birmingham based charity which operates primarily in Yemen. They are working tirelessly to help those affected by ending their hunger, quenching their thirst, providing medication for those suffering from Cholera and ultimately giving them hope. Through your donations, we can help to make a difference to our brothers and sisters around the world who are suffering right now.

We are all so blessed to eat well and to be in good health during this huge pandemic, let's donate something to help our brothers and sisters less fortunate than us (even if it's small).

Jazakamullah khair (May God reward you all)
Title: Abdullahs Ramadan Page for Yemen

Description:
RAMADAN is the BEST of MONTHS to give CHARITY.

*Now is the Time to Give, Now is the Time to Feed*. Together we will be the difference between a family facing another day of fasting without an Iftar to break it, or that family having plentiful meals throughout the holy month, fully able to observe the blessings of Ramadan.

I have made a pledge to raise funds this Ramadan to feed families across 7 countries!

I need your support to feed families this Ramadan. Help me to raise as much as funds as possible! NOW IS THE TIME TO FEED

One in every nine people will go to bed hungry this Ramadan. That’s over 820 million people who don’t have enough food to eat, and that’s before we consider the current food scarcity hitting people across the globe.

To a hungry family struggling to find food for Iftar, one simple donation can be a lifeline. Now is the time to give!

One donation of £70 can make a difference to a family in Somalia, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Iraq, Palestine, Syria and Yemen.

Here is your chance to earn the rewards of Sadaqah and Zakat (Eligible) as the rewards of giving are multiplied by 70 times in the month of Ramadan.

“*The best charity is that given in Ramadan*.” [At-Tirmidi]
Title: Shajna Aamilah's Feed the Fasting Campaign "Now is the Time to Feed"

Description:
Hello, my son Oscar is 7 years old and is hoping you will support him to raise funds for the Trussell Trust.

We know that people are suffering in different ways during the Coronavirus and Oscar wants to do something to help people who have very little or no food to eat and who are relying on food banks to keep their families going during these times. Oscar would like to raise money for the Trussell Trust which is a charity that helps to provide food parcels to people in need across the UK. 

Oscar has decided to do a Practice-O-Thon with his violin and is looking for sponsorship to donate to the Trussell Trust. He says "I love my violin and was hoping to take my next exam in the Summer, but that has been cancelled because of the virus. But I need to keep up with my practice! I will be practising very hard for the month of May on my scales, sight reading and pieces and hope that you will sponsor me and we can help lots of families who need food."

You can either make a one-off donation or sponsor 5p or 10p (or whatever amount you would like to) per minute that Oscar practises.  We will keep a record of the time he practises and give a regular update on this page. 

Oscar says "I hope to video some of the pieces I practise and learn during May and send it to the residents of a care home where I gave a little violin concert last year. Hopefully it will sound good!"

All money raised will go to the Trussell Trust. You can read more about their work below. 

Thank you very much for your support!

Jo-Ann and Oscar Fowler

About the Trussell Trust:

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year. Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure. We're working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that they're able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: Oscar's Practice-A-Thon

Description:
The Back Story
A few months ago, Charlie said that if Diego Costa didn't get booked, he would eat dog food. 2 minutes later, Diego Costa was subbed off and Charlie found himself in a bit of a situation when InplayMan Matt screenshotted that tweet and put the pressure on.

A few months down the line, Charlie (who by the way gags at the sight of an onion) still hasn't done it, so now, Matt has convinved him to do it, on two conditions. 1) It's for charity, 2) He does it too

The Targets
£100 - Charlie chomps a spoonful of dog food
£250 - Charlie and Matt chomp 2 spoonfuls of dog food each
£500 - Charlie and Matt chomp 3 spoonfuls of dog food each
£1000 - Charlie and Matt chomp half a tin of dog food each
£2500 - Charlie and Matt chomp a whole tin of dog food each

We will find a way to stream the event which takes place on the 31st of May. However much we raise in the next month will decide how much we #ChompForCharity

The Charity
We were going to do this for the NHS given the current situation, but everybody is doing that and the incredible Captain Tom just gave them nearly £30 million. So we've decided to support CALM who help to try and prevent male suicide. I think I talk for all of us blokes locked in the house when I say our mental health has been challenged recently, so charities like CALM who have no doubt seen a decrease in donations lately really need our help to continue their incredible work.

The Campaign Against Living Miserably (CALM) is leading a movement against suicide, the single biggest killer of men under 45 in the UK. Our goal is a life less miserable for you, your friends, your family and for all men.CALM PROVIDES> A free and anonymous helpline 0800 58 58 58 and webchat (5pm-12am daily) staffed by trained professionals> Bereavement support > A website www.theCALMzone.net with inspiring content> Campaigns tackling stereotypes of masculinity, suicide and mental health. Help us save lives.
Title: InplayMan & Tipster Charlie's Dog Food #ChompForCharity

Description:
Assalamualeikum everyone!

I hope you're all well in sha Allah!

Food supply chains have been disrupted by COVID-19. Those most vulnerable around the world can’t even get the basics such as food they need to survive.

This ramadhan, with Islamic relief,  I have pledged to raise £2000 to help distribute food parcels in 31 countries across the globe where most needed.

£50 can provide a family of 6 with food for a month.

The Prophet (SAW) said: “Give charity without delay, for it stands in the way of calamity.” (Tirmidhi)

We know that these times are tough on everyone, but Allah tells us that giving charity increases your sustenance! Allah is indeed the Most Generous, Alhamdulillah.

So, lets give more than ever this Ramadan!

Jazakallah khair

Zainab

Title: Zainab's Global Ramadan food parcels

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.

As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: PHE Col Food Aid

Description:
‘The example of the Believers in their mutual love, mercy and compassion for one another is like one body; if one limb complains then the whole body responds to it in restlessness and fever.’ [Sahih Muslim]The balance of wealth and justice remains absent in the world today. For at least three quarters of the world’s population, poverty is a fact of life. Hunger, sickness, homelessness and more cast a heavy shadow over their lives as they struggle to survive with little or no support.Ummah Welfare Trust formed as an NGO in 2001 with the goal of challenging this state of affairs. Inspired by the Islamic teachings of empathy and selflessness, the charity would strive to support and uplift the impoverished through the beautiful act of charity.

Countries like Pakistan do not have options like furlough schemes for workers and thousands will be out of work while they are in lockdown. I hope that we can at least help these people with at least food to feed their families InshaAllah
Title: Food packages for Pakistan
